He goes about this activity using a wagon pulled by horses, which he owns.  He travels in the same wagon with the hogs.

He needs the financing in order to invest in the purchase of hogs to offer his established and new customers.  José Anastasio is grateful to the Kiva investors for their help and opportunities for a dignified life that they offer the small vendors with few resources living in poor countries like Nicaragua.  In this way, they are helping to eradicate some of the poverty of our country.

loans.use:
para invertir en la compra y venta de cerdos en pie
to invest in the purchase and sale of live hogs.

loans.name: Ivania Veronica

texts.es: Ivania Verónica de 46 anos de edad del departamento de Chinandega, casada, con dos hijos, de  15, 11 anos de edad los cuales están bajo su cargo, además estudian en primaria y secundaria respetivamente. Ivania Verónica es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable, ella ha trabajado con fundación león 2000 la cual ha demostrado su responsabilidad y solvencia de pago, Ivania se desempeña como maestra de un colegio de su localidad, ya que para ella es un gusto y satisfacción  poder trabajar con niños y transmitirle los conocimientos adquiridos en le transcurso de su desempeño como maestra, para formas personas de bien y que en un futuro sean el porvenir de Nicaragua. Un país con tantas limitantes para los jóvenes. El financiamiento lo necesita para construir un cuarto a la vivienda, ya que en la actualidad todos duermen en la misma habitación  y no tienen ninguna privacidad, incluso su hija la mayor esta señorita y necesita tener mas espacio, y brindarles mejores  condiciones a sus hijos. Dichas mejoras la ha necesitado realizar desde hace 2 anos las cuales por falta de ingresos suficientes no las ha realizado esta inversión .Por lo tanto acudió al financiamiento para realizar dicha mejoras. El material que necesita comprar para la construcción es lo siguiente zinc, cemento, arena, hierro, cal, calvos, bloques, madera.
texts.en:
Ivania Verónica, 46, is from Chinandega Department.  She’s married and has two children who are 15 and 11 years old and are in her care.  They attend elementary and secondary school.  

Ivania Verónica is a very hardworking, responsible person who has worked with Fundación León 2000 and has shown responsibility and payment solvency.  Ivania works as a teacher in a local school.  For her, it’s a joy and a satisfaction to work with children and pass on the knowledge she’s acquired during her career as a teacher to form upstanding citizens who will become the future of Nicaragua, a country with so many obstacles for young people.

She needs the financing to add a room at home since everyone currently sleeps in the same room and have no privacy.  In fact, her oldest daughter is a young woman now needing her own space and Ivania must provide better living conditions for her children.

These home improvements have been needed for the last two years but she’s been unable to do them for lack of funds which is why she called on a loan to do them.  She needs to buy building materials and supplies like metal sheeting, cement, sand, rebar, lime powder, nails, concrete blocks and lumber.

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, metal sheeting and sand.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 45-year-old Fatmata from Moriba town Southern area in Bo. She is married with 2 children, ages 20 and 23. Her husband is a teacher; his income is not enough to support the home.

Fatmata runs a general store, selling gari, palm oil, and fruit. She has been running this business for 7 years. She works at the business 11 hours a day, 7 days per week. She also earns income from renting out a house. Her business growth has improved, but the challenge of a poor road network remains.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more goods like gari, palm oil, and fruit to sell. The extra income from this loan will allow her to take care of the home and pay her installment. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more goods like gari, palm oil, and fruit to sell

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 32 years old and married to Anne. He sells clothes--a business he started eight years ago--and earns a monthly income of KES 50,000.

He has requested a second loan of KES 40,000 to purchase more bales of clothes for sale. The profit will help him improve his living standards. His dream is to see this business expand.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 56 years old. She is a widow and a mother of one child. She operates a grocery shop in Kiambu and has been in this business for 4 years now. She gets a monthly income of 9,000 KES.

This will be Jane’s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy tomatoes, potatoes, and other vegetables for resale. She says she will use the profit to add more stock for her business. 

In the future, Jane wants to fully provide for her child and also become self-sustainable.

loans.use: To buy vegetables like cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, etc. for resale

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala is from Tkibuli district of West Georgia. She is 65 years old and lives with her husband Zauri, daughter, son-in-law and grandson. Makvala and Zauri are provided with a retirement pension. Her daughter works as a cook in the restaurant and gets a monthly income. The family runs a small dairy business; they have 3 milk cows and 2 calves. Makvala milks the cows and produces cheese products. She also has a vineyard and picks the grapes in the late summer. The family sells their agricultural products at the local market. Makvala works hard to make some savings and improve their living conditions.

Makvala requested a loan to repair her house. The existing house is old and damaged. She will purchase building materials and renovate her house. Then the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard-working day in a more comfortable environment. Makvala hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 5 years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her small business, which tailors all types of clothes and other materials. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a new sewing machine and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and pay school fees. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Siah

texts.en: Siah, 42, resides with her husband in Kakata. She has five children that are between the ages of 8 and 26. All of her children do not live with her, as they stay with their aunt and other relatives. They are all in school; the oldest child is a college student. She has been selling rice, onions, tomatoes, sardines, cooking oil, dish soap, bath soap, and other items for the past ten years.  With the initial capital from her husband, she started this business. She loves to run her business, because she interacts with people every day and makes a profit from what she sells. With the profit, she will buy more goods and improve her business and her life. She has requested this loan to purchase more rice, cooking oil, dish soap, bath soap, and onions for her business. She plans to become a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, cooking oil, dish soap, bath soap, and onions for her business

loans.name: Abishyizehamwe/ Kzh Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Jean Josias est le membre et le président du groupe Abishyizehamwe / Kzh. Le nom du groupe signifie «Union des membres  ».Il a 30 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 1 an à 3 ans. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Jean Josias est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour accroitre la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur agriculteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Jean Josias is a member and the leader of the Abishyizehamwe / Kzh group.  The name of the group means, “union of the members.”  He is 30 and married with two children, aged 1 and 3 years.  He has had six years of primary school education.

Jean Josias grows rice.  This is his first loan through ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and to pay those who work for him in his rice growing business.

In order to grow his business, he plans to request other loans for increasing his rice growing capacity.  In the years to come, he would like to be the biggest rice cultivator in the region.  With his profits, he foresees being able to pay for his children’s education and health care.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay those who work for him in his rice cultivating business.

loans.name: Unión De Amigas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN DE AMIGA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de tucumanas, venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, salón de belleza, venta de conservas, venta e libros, venta de electrodomésticos, ferretería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rina es una integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución quien fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de ferretería, que emprendió hace años con la compra de materiales de construcción.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de pinturas) que comprará de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente lo distribuirá en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.

En la fotografía no esta presente la señora María pues fue a consulta médica.
texts.en:
The “Unión de Amigas” (Unity of Girlfriends) communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board whose president is Rina.  The members carry out a variety of businesses among which are the sale of ‘tucumanas’ [turnovers], clothing sales, cosmetics sales, beauty salon, canned goods sales, book sales, home appliance sales and hardware sales.

They will take out the loan to benefit small businesswomen.  Rina’s one of them and she indicates that this is her first time joining Pro Mujer thanks to an invitation from one of the institution’s promoters who visited her at home.  She currently has a hardware store she opened years ago with the purchase of construction materials.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy paint from suppliers and then resell in her shop.  This way of working allows her to support her family since she’s married and has five children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the credit training and the health services.  

(María does not appear in the photo because she was at a clinic appointment.)

loans.use: to buy paint.

loans.name: Lilliam Maria

texts.es: Lilliam María  de 29 anos de edad, madre  soltera con una hija de 12 anos bajo su responsabilidad, Lilliam pertenece al municipio de chichigalpa, el cual esta ubicado en el occidente del país, un chichigalpa es un municipio muy bonito, con gente acogedora, servicial, esta rodeado de volcanes, naturaleza pura, y muy productivo en cana de azúcar. Lilliam tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general, tiene tres anos de experiencia en el negocio, el cual distribuye de forma ambulante, y da servicio de lavado y planchado a domicilio. El negocio surgió por la necesidad de tener un medio para vivir y poder mantener a su pequeña ya que es  madre soltera. Esta iniciativa de trabajo la inicio con los créditos que fundación le brindaba  y comenzó a invertir en venta de ropa y poco a poco fue ganando clientela, debido a su esfuerzo, tenacidad, responsabilidad. La rutina diaria de Lilliam es de 10 horas diarias día a día, ella se levanta temprano todos los días,  y carga su mercadería  en bolsos la cual distribuye de forma ambulante a clientes fijos y eventuales, su rutina es dura bajo el intenso sol el pesos de los bolsos con la mercadería, pero eso no le impide seguir trabajando porque quiere logara su sueños  mas anhelado como es formar profesionalmente a su pequeña hija. Motivo por el cual agrade a los inversionistas kiva la ayuda que les prestan a personas de escasos recursos y de países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno.
texts.en:
Lilliam María, 29, is a single mother who takes care of her 12-year-old daughter. Lilliam lives in the city of Chichigalpa, located in the western part of the country. Chichigalpa is very beautiful, and its people are warm and accommodating. The city is surrounded by volcanos and natural beauty, and the area produces a lot of sugar cane. Lilliam has three years of experience selling general merchandise as a street vendor and offering in-home laundry and ironing service. She started the business because she needed to make a living and support her daughter, as she is a single mother. She began buying clothing to resell and slowly built a client base through much effort and tenacity. 

Lillian's workday lasts 10 hours. She gets up early every morning to fill the bags of merchandise she will deliver on foot to regular and potential customers. Her routine is hard, given the intensity of the sun and the weight of her bags of merchandise, but that doesn't keep her from working because she wants to achieve her dreams. What she wishes for most is to see her daughter pursue a profession. She thanks the Kiva lenders for the help they offer low-income people to have a decent life in poor countries such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as clothing for adults and children.

loans.name: Oseas Neftali

texts.es:
Oseas, está solicitando otro crédito porque necesita invertir en su negocio en ampliación de ventas y aumentar la compra de materia prima, algunos de los productos que necesita comprar son: manteca, huevos,  azúcar, aceite, leña y una licuadora.
El primer crédito que se le extendió, tuvo un efecto muy grande en su pequeña empresa, por le permitió mantener su clientela y  logro tener una mejor rentabilidad en su negocio.
texts.en: Oseas is seeking another loan because he needs to invest in his bakery and increase his sales.  He needs to purchase more raw materials such as butter, eggs, sugar, oil, firewood and a blender.  His first loan had a very positive effect on his small business.  It enabled him to keep his customers satisfied and achieve more profitability.

loans.use: to buy butter, eggs, sugar, oil, firewood and a blender.

loans.name: Dushyigikirane/ Nykby Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Protogène est le membre et le président du groupe Dushyikirane / Nykby. Le nom du groupe signifie «Supportons-nous ».Il à 37 ans et il est marié avec 4 enfants de 3 an à 14 ans, dont 3 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Protogène est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour accroitre la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur agriculteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Protogène is a member and the leader of the Dushyikirane / Nykby group.  The name of the group means, “Let's help each other.”  He is 37 and married with four children between the ages of 3 and 14  years, three of whom attend school.  He has had six years of primary school.

Mr. Protogène grows rice.  This is his first loan through ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and to pay those who work for him in his rice growing business.

In order to grow his business, he plans to request other loans  for increasing  his rice growing capacity.  In the years to come, he would like to be the biggest rice cultivator in the region.  With his profits, he foresees being able to pay for his children’s education and health care.

loans.use: He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and to pay those who work for him in his rice growing business.

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es:
Luz es una señora de 49 años, que se describe como una persona emprendedora, felíz, trabajadora y muy responsable. Luz vive con sus tres hijos en Ibarra.

Luz trabaja en un puesto de venta de productos de herbalife, también utiliza estos productos para preparar batidos para los clientes y de esta manera obtener ingresos económicos, Luz se ha dedicado en este negocio por 12 años, actualmente Luz necesita incrementar su negocio debido a que tiene la necesidad de comprar constantemente productos para que su negocio siga prosperando es por eso que solicita un crédito a Fodemi con el objetivo de invertir en la compra de productos de herbalife como batidos f1, té, aloe, calcio, necesita comprar 15 frascos de cada uno.

Luz sueña en que su negocio crezca y que en un futuro sea un negocio de venta de medicina natural y obtener buenos ingresos con los cuales quiere construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Luz, 49, describes herself as an enterprising, happy, hardworking and very responsible woman.  She lives with her three children in Ibarra.

Luz works in a stand selling Herbalife products.  She also uses these products to make blended drinks for customers as a way of earning income.  Luz has been in this business for 12 years.  She now needs to increase business because she constantly must buy products so that her business will continue making progress and this is why she’s asking Fodemi for a loan to buy Herbalife products like F1 mix, tea, aloe, calcium; she needs to buy 15 jars of each.

Luz dreams with her business growing and that in the future it becomes a business selling natural remedies and to earn good income with which she wants to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy Herbalife products.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, tiene treinta y siete años de edad, está casado, tiene una hija de tres años, viven en casa propia, él se dedica a la panadería en la reventa de pan ha tomado la decisión de continuar trabajando; pero necesita financiamiento, por lo que nos solicito un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercadería tal como: pan dulce y pan francés.
Este crédito le ayudara a incrementar el inventario y su atencion a la clientela, tambien tendrá más ingresos y le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio; sus sueños es incrementar las ganancias y estar mejor económicamente, darle una vida mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 37 years old, married, and has a three-year-old daughter. They live in their own home and he works reselling baked goods. He has made the decision to continue working but needs financing, which is why he has requested a loan to invest in purchasing merchandise such as pastries and French bread.

This loan will help him increase inventory and improve the service he gives his customers. He will also have more income and this will help him strengthen his business. His dreams are to increase profit and achieve a better financial situation so that he can give his family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale pastries and French bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building the wall.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
María, vive en casa propia, tiene treinta años de edad, está acompañada no tiene hijos, trabaja cultivando maíz  para obtener ingresos y poder mantenerse; Tiene  dos años de trabajar lo aprendió desde pequeña.
Esta solicitando un crédito, para comprar insumos para la cosecha,  compra de tres sacos de abono, herbicidas, insecticidas y para el pago de mano de obra, ademas la compra de semilla para la producción.
Seguidamente sacar esa cosecha a la venta para obtener ganancias y que sus ingresos puedan cubrir las necesidades del hogar
texts.en:
María is a 30-year-old woman lives in her own home with her common-law husband.  They currently do not have children.  She grows corn in order to make income and support herself.  She has been working as a farmer for two years and learned this discipline when she was a child.

She is seeking a loan in order to purchase farming supplies.  She will buy three sacks of fertilizer, as well as herbicides and insecticides and seed corn.  She will also use the funds to pay laborers.

Following the harvest, she will sell the corn in order to make income so that she will be able to cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides, as well as to pay laborers.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: La Sra. Marcelina  tiene 35 años y es casada tiene tres hijos que son de las edades de 8, 4 y 2 años, se dedica  a la elaboración y venta de comida ella vende chicharrón de pollo en su puesto de venta que  se encuentra ubicado en la zona Primero de Mayo, le va muy bien con esta actividad ya que su negocio se encuentra en un lugar estratégico, este préstamo es el primero que tiene dentro de la institución, la Sra. Marcelina  vive en la localidad de Sacaba donde escasea el agua la mayor parte del tiempo se compra agua de las cisternas que ofrecen agua por cada zona a un precio módico, por este motivo el solicito este préstamo para la construcción de un tanque de agua para poder tener reserva de agua ya que una de las principales acciones para la construcción de un Tanque de agua es para almacenar y distribuir el agua, construcción de cañerías que lleva el agua hasta las distintas dependencia como el baño, ducha y cocina y esto es de mucha utilidad ya que las cisternas van una vez a la semana y muchas veces su familia se queda sin agua y este liquido elemento es imprescindible en cada hogar y con la construcción de este tanque de agua la Sra. Marcelina mejorara de gran manera su calidad de vida, por este motivo se siente agradecido por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 35, is married and has three children who are 8, 4, and 2 years of age.  She works making food to sell; she sells fried chicken in a stand located in the Primero de Mayo neighborhood.  She does very well with this activity since her business is in a strategic location.  This will be her first loan with the institution.

Marcelina lives in Sacaba where water is scarce most of the time.  Water must be purchased at moderate prices from tank trucks that come by the various neighborhoods.  Because of this, she requests a loan to install a water tank to be able to have water in storage since one of the main reasons for installing a water tank is to have water available in storage and then to install piping to bring water to the various spots where it’s needed like the toilet, shower and kitchen.  This is very useful because the tank trucks come by only once a week and sometimes her family is left without this liquid which is essential in every home.  By installing the tank, Marcelina will greatly improve her quality of life and this is why she’s very grateful for the opportunity she’s being given.

loans.use: to install a water tank.

loans.name: Impuzamugambi / Gkndmvr Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Augustin est le membre et le président du groupe Impuzamugambi. Le nom du groupe signifie «Les membres qui ont le même objectif ».Il à 42 ans et il est marié avec 6 enfants de 3 ans à 21 ans, dont 5 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Augustin est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier  cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur agriculteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mr Augustin is a member and the leader of the Impuzamugambi group.  The name of the group means, “Members who have the same goal.”  He is 42 and married with six children between the ages of 3 and 21 years, five of whom attend school.   He has had six years of primary school.

Augustin grows rice.  This is his first loan through ACB.  He is going to use his loan to buy fertilizers and to pay those who work for him in his rice growing business.

In order to grow his business, he plans to request other loans for increasing  his rice growing capacity.  In the years to come, he would like to be the biggest rice cultivator in the region.  With his profits, he foresees being able to pay for his children’s education and health care.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay those who work for him in his rice growing business.

loans.name: Esmeralda Paulina

texts.es:
La Esmeralda solicita el préstamo para solventar los gastos de inscripción, compra de útiles y uniformes de sus hijos quienes cursan la secundaria y primaria, ya que son su responsabilidad darles la educación necesaria para que tengan un futuro triunfador.
La señora Esmeralda es originaria de esta ciudad y trabaja para una fábrica en el aria de producción desde hace ya más de un año, este es el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el crédito, ya que también cuenta la pensión que le entrega su ex esposo para la ayuda de sus hijos.
Desea que sus hijos tengan el estudio y la educación necesaria.
texts.en:
Esmeralda requests the loan to pay tuition, buy school supplies and uniforms for her children who are attending primary and secondary school since it’s her responsibility to provide them with the necessary education so that they can have a successful future.

Esmeralda is from this city and has been employed in a factory in the production area for more than a year.  This is her source of family income and part of it will be used to repay the loan since she also gets child support from her ex-husband.  She wants her children to have schooling and the necessary education.

loans.use: to pay school costs.

loans.name: Carla Adriana

texts.es: La Sra. Carla  tiene 35 años tiene dos hijos que tienen la edad de 17 y 15 años, ella se dedica a la confección y bordado a mano de manteles, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace ya varios años, su taller se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Villa Cotapachi, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Carla  utilizara este préstamo para el mantenimiento y compra de un motor para su vehículo, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital ya que este vehículo le ayuda a transportar su mercadería de trabajo, la Sra. Carla enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad de la confección de las prendas de vestir y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo su deseo para su negocio es crecer y confeccionar variedad de prendas, la Sra. Carla se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Carla, 35, has two children who are 17 and 15 years old.  She makes and hand embroiders tablecloths.  She’ been doing this for several years now and her workshop is located in the Villa Cotopachi zone.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution.  Carla will use it to service her car and to buy an engine for it.  Her reason for requesting the loan is the lack of capital and this vehicle helps her transport her work merchandise.  The business challenge Carla faces is to continue improving the quality of her sewing clothes and will use profits to continue increasing working capital for her wish for her business is that it continues growing and producing a variety of articles.  Carla feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a car engine and to service the vehicle.

loans.name: Leny Elizabeth

texts.es:
Leny,  vive en casa alquilada, tiene treinta y seis años de edad, tiene dos hijos de seis y de nueve años,  ella es la única  que trabaja para obtener los ingresos del hogar,  se dedica a la venta de pupusas, fue iniciativa propia poner el negocio, tiene dos años trabajando.
Ella  ha solicitado un préstamo para comprar materia prima para hacer el producto como lo son: maíz, aceites, carnes, quesillo, tomates, repollo, lo cual le permitirá aumentar sus ventas.
Su sueño es mantener el negocio que le permita salir adelante en las situaciones económicas que se presenten como suplir necesidades de salud y  alimentacion.
texts.en:
Leny lives in a rented house.  She’s 36-years-old and has two children who are 6 and 9 years of age. She’s the only one who works to earn household income.  She sells pupusas [filled, grilled corncakes].  She opened the business on her own initiative and has been working two years.

She has requested the loan to buy raw materials like corn, oil, meats, string cheese, tomatoes and cabbage to make her pupusas in order to increase her sales.  Her dream is to stay in business so that she can overcome economic difficulties that arise like covering health and food costs.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro, se decidió por otro crédito, por necesidad de invertir en su negocio, el crédito lo necesita para comprar pulseras, CD, juguetes, todo lo relacionado con la bisutería para sacarlo a la venta, este prestamo le sera muy util para fortalcer su mercaderia.
Su experiencia con el crédito anterior le dio mucho beneficio; porque aumentaron sus utilidades , su familia se ha mantenido; pero su calidad de vida a mejorado.
texts.en:
Pedro opted for another loan because he needs to invest in his business.  He needs the loan to buy bracelets, CDs, toys and everything related to costume jewelry to sell.  This loan will be very useful for him to strengthen his merchandise.  

His prior credit experience was very beneficial because his profits increased.  His family has remained stable but its quality of life has been improving.

loans.use: to buy bracelets, CDs and toys.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, ayote y tambien tiene un molino de nixtamal, tiene cuarenta y ocho años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos  de 1,3 y 9 años de edad.
Se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace treinta años trabaja todo los días de 5.00am a las 4.00pm  dependiendo la temporada, a la fecha no presenta riesgo alguno.
Nos solicita un crédito para la compra de abono, herbicidas y otros fertilizantes agrícolas y de esta manera  ayudara la produccion de su cultivo y a toda su familia con los gastos económicos.Sus sueños y aspiraciones es sacar adelante a sus hijos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Jose is a farmer who grows corn and pumpkins, and he also has a tortilla-flour mill. He is 48 years old, married, and has 3 children, ages 1, 3 and 9. Jose has farmed for the last 30 years, working every day from 5:00 am until 4:00 pm, depending upon the season. At present, he presents no [financial] risk whatsoever.

Jose is requesting a loan to buy manure, herbicides and other agricultural fertilizers. In this manner, he hopes to boost crop production and aid everyone in his family with their economic expenses. His dreams and aspirations are to advance his children in their studies.

loans.use: purchase manure, herbicides and other fertilizers for his corn and pumpkin crops.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La Sra. Miriam tiene 33 años, tiene un hijo llamado Tiago, es madre soltera, y está cursando la carrera de medicina, además tiene un local de ventas de artesanías en cemento y barro, actividad que realiza desde hace mas de 3 años, con la ayuda de toda su familia.
Cuenta que le va muy bien ya que tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre compra de ella sus esculturas y obras, es una persona con muchos sueños e ideales y comenta que todo lo que hace es por su hijo para poder darle un buen estilo de vida.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de barro y cemento para poder invertirlos en las obras que ella vende.
texts.en:
Miriam is 33 years old and has a son named Tiago. She is a single mother and is studying medicine. In addition, she has an artisan stall where she cells cement and clay products. She has done this work for more than three years with the help of her whole family.

She says that it is going very well because she now has a well established clientele that always buys her sculptures and work. She is a person with many dreams and ideals. She says that everything she does is for her son so that she can give him a better way of life. 

She is requesting a loan to buy clay and cement to invest in the works that she sells.

loans.use: to buy clay and cement.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María, de 46 años, es una mujer alegre y con muchas ganas de vivir, es soltera y tiene 4 hijos y con ellos comparte su casa propia que construyó con su ex pareja mientras vivían junto a él, día a día luchan  por salir adelante y mejorar su nivel de vida. María inicia su trabajo desde muy temprano con la compra de distintas frutas de la región como papayas, bananas, naranjas y otros productos las cuales adquiere del mercado principal de la ciudad en la que vive. La venta lo realiza en su casa, ahí acondiciona una mesa amplia en donde exhibe todos los productos que pone a la venta para satisfacción de su clientela. Eventualmente realiza mermeladas con las frutas que están mas maduras y posteriormente también los pone a la venta. Su vivienda está ubicada en un zona muy transitada y eso le permite tener a diario muy buenas ventas. Lleva en ésta actividad más de 4 años y trabaja generalmente sola aunque a veces recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Complementa este negocio con la venta de gaseosas y helados cuyas ganancias le ayudan a sobrellevar los gastos básicos de su hogar. Le gusta su trabajo porque le permite desarrollar un actividad que no requiere de gran esfuerzo, además le permite tener el tiempo libre necesario por las tardes para realizar otras funciones que también le rinden ganancias, espera agrandar su negocio pues tiene todas las ganas y el deseo de poder superar sus mismas expectativas. Este es el crédito número 3 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que existen personas que le brindan un apoyo financiero que le permitirá estar más tranquila y avanzar con sus planes de su negocio, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y sobre todo compenetrarse más con los integrantes de su banco comunal que son muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará mas frutas para implementar su negocio, además comprará yuca y plátano ya que son productos de gran demanda por parte de sus clientes.
texts.en:
María, who is 46 years old, is a joyful woman with a passion for life.  She is single and has four children with whom she shares her home which she built with her ex while they were living together.  Day after day, they struggle to get ahead and improve their quality of life.  María begins working very early, purchasing the various regional fruits like papayas, bananas, oranges and other products which she acquires from the main market in the city where she lives.  She makes her sales out of her home; she has a large table set up where she displays all of the products that she sells for the satisfaction of her customers.  Eventually, she makes jams with the fruits that are very ripe and then she also sells them.  Her home is located in a well traveled area and this allows her to have very good sales on a daily basis.  She has worked over four years at this and she generally works by herself, although sometimes she receives help from her children.  She supplements this business with the sale of soft drinks and ice cream, the profits from which help her to bear the household expenses.  She enjoys her work because it allows her to complete tasks that don't require great effort.  Moreover, it permits her to have the necessary free time in the afternoons to complete other tasks which also provide income.  She hopes to expand her business.  She has the willpower and the desire to be able to supersede her own expectations.  This is her third loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that there exist people who offer financial support that will allow her to be more calm and advance with her business plan.  Moreover, she promises to make her payments punctually and above all, to empathize with the other members of her communal bank who are very supportive.

With the amount of 1000 soles requested, she will purchase more fruits to add to her business, as well as yucca and plantains, since they are products with a high demand from her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit, yucca, and plantains.

loans.name: Eugenio Jose

texts.es:
Eugenio esta casado y tiene hijos pequeños.El es un hombre humilde muy trabajador se dedica a la pesca desde muy joven su padre le enseño esta actividad  y desde entonces no ha parado de hacer esta labor.

El es el sustento de su hogar y su esposa se dedica al cuidado de los niños ya  que son muy pequeños aun, una de las  dificultades que el tiene son los piratas de los rios.

El sueño de Eugenio es terminar su casa por completo ya que la esta construyendo poco a poco debido a la falta de recursos. con el prestamo desea comprar una lancha con motor para seguir su negocio anhela que sus hijos estudien y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Eugenio is married and has small children.  He is a very hard-working, humble man.  He has been fishing since he was very young.  That is when his father taught him this business activity.  From then on he has not stopped doing this work.

He supports his household, and his wife devotes herself to caring for the children because they are still very young.  The pirates on the river are one of the difficulties that he has.

Eugenio’s dream is to completely finish his house.  He is building it little by little due to the lack of resources.  

Using the loan he hopes to buy a motorboat in order to continue his business.  He wishes for his children to get an education and to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: Kiria

texts.es:
Kiria tiene 36 años, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su pareja es Flaubert, quien es policía, y el padre de sus dos hijos de 10 y 5 años.
Su actividad es la venta de cervezas y gaseosas. Tiene un pequeño espacio en su vivienda que ha destinado para este trabajo. Ha logrado comprarse una congeladora en la cual guarda todas las bebidas. Su casa está ubicada en una zona donde existen fábricas de madera y es debido a ese detalle es que siempre tiene clientes. Tiene más de 4 años dedicándose a este negocio y hasta el momento lo realiza ella sola. Le gusta su negocio, pues le genera un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, además de estar en la comodidad de su casa y tener tiempo disponible para dedicarlo a otras actividades. 

Este es su préstamo número 11 con la institución MFP, es por ello que agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito financiero para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado, de 2000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de 20 cajas de cervezas y 8 cajas de gaseosas, cuyo promedio de inversión semanal varía de 1000 a 1200 soles. Además, parte del dinero lo destinará al arreglo del espacio donde atiende a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kiria, 36, is a very hardworking, determined woman who very much wants to get ahead.  Her spouse is Flaubert who is a policeman and the father of their two children who are 10 and 5 years old.

Her activity is selling beer and soft-drinks.  She has a small space at home dedicated to this business.  She’s managed to buy a refrigerator where she stores all the beverages.  Her house is located in a zone where there are many sawmills and because of this she has many customers.  She’s been in this business for more than four years and to date works alone.  She likes her business because it generates income to help her spouse cover household expenses.  In addition, she can work from the comfort of home and have time to do other things.

This is MFP loan #11 for her which is why she’s grateful to all the people who give her the opportunity to access financing to be able to make her plans a reality.  On the other hand, she comments that she’s comfortable in her communal bank because she knows all the members and considers them to be responsible, supportive people.

She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy 20 cases of beer and 8 cases of soft-drinks which cost on average between 1000 and 1200 soles.  She will use part of the money to equip the space where she tends to customers.

loans.use: to buy 20 cases of beer and 8 cases of soft-drinks.

loans.name: Gullermo Ramon

texts.es: Guillermo es originario de Granada de 35 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos junto a su compañera de vida, es mecánico oficio que ejerce desde hace 5 años en su propio negocio. Inicio sus actividades trabajando con su papa quien era dueño de un taller y desde niño le enseño esta actividad a el y a sus hermanos a que aprendiera mecánica, siendo a el quien le gusto mas el oficio y de esta manera con el paso del tiempo decidió poner su propio negocio ubicado en su casa apoyado por un hermano que le paga mano de obra. No cuenta con otros ingresos para la sostenibilidad de su familia y su hogar  solo con los ingresos que le genera el taller. Por eso Guillermo solicita un crédito kiva para comprar repuestos como bujía, carbones, balineras, foco y tuercas que son parte de las herramientas y repuestos  que utiliza para trabajar. Este crédito le ayudara a crecer en su negocio por que tendrá mas clientes fijos y mejores ganancias ya que a parte de ofrecer servicio de mecánica venderá el repuesto que necesite el cliente. Sus planes futuros es lograr ampliar el local y poner aparte un área de venta de repuestos teniendo asi un taller de éxito.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a native of Granada, Nicaragua.  He is 35 years old and lives with his common-law wife and two children.  He is a mechanic who has had his own business for five years.  When he was a child he worked alongside his father, who was the owner of an auto repair garage.  His father taught the business to him and his brothers.  Guillermo was the one who liked this business most of all, and as time passed he decided to open his own home-based business, supported by one brother whom he pays for his work.

He does not have any other sources of income to support his family and his household, only the income that comes from this business.  For this reason he is seeking a Kiva loan in order to buy spare parts such as spark plugs, carbon brushes, ball-bearings, nuts and light bulbs that are necessary for him to do his job.  This loan will help him to grow his business and begin selling parts in addition to performing repairs.  This will allow him to obtain more regular customers and better earnings.

In the future he plans to expand his working space and dedicate an area to the sale of parts, which will allow him to have a successful shop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts such as spark plugs, carbon brushes, ball-bearings, nuts and light bulbs.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Alida tiene 25 años, su pareja es Percy, con quien tiene tres hijos: María Fernanda de 5, Edith de 4 y Yamile de un año. Esta familia vive en su casa propia ubicada en una localidad rural.
Ella se dedica a la agricultura desde hace más de 5 años, desde que tuvo a su primer hijo. Junto a su esposo, siembra arvejas, maíz, papas y flores. Las arvejas le brindan buenos ingresos porque sus precios son estables, pero las flores (gladiolos) son más rentables por su poca inversión y rápida cosecha; “siembro dos veces al año y trato que las cosechas coincidan con los meses donde el precio sube”, comenta. La papa, maíz y arvejas las vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Ahora iniciará una nueva siembra de arvejas, para lo cual requiere de apoyo.
Este es su préstamo número 8 que obtiene de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Picaflores de Patay”, y se siente a gusto de tener socios responsables y cumplidos en sus pagos.
Alida invertirá el dinero de su crédito en la compra de tres sacos de semillas de arvejas y bolsas de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Alida is 25 years old. Her husband is Percy, with whom she has three children: María Fernanda is five, Edith is four, and Yamile is one year old. This family lives in their own house located in a rural community.

Alida has worked in agriculture for more than five years, since she had her first child. Together with her husband, she plants peas, corn, potatoes, and flowers. The peas bring in a good income because their price is stable, but the flowers (gladiolus) are more profitable because of their low investment costs and quick harvest time. "I plant twice a year and try to have the harvests coincide with the months when the prices are up," she explains. She sells the potatoes, corn, and peas in the city wholesale market. Now she will start a new crop of peas, for which she needs support.

This is her eighth loan through MFP, so she promises to be punctual with her monthly loan payments. She belongs to the communal bank "Los Picaflores de Patay" ["The Hummingbirds of Patay"], and she feels pleased to have responsible members who are reliable with their payments. 

Alida will invest the money from her loan in the purchase of three sacks of pea seeds and bags of fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy three sacks of pea seeds and bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Lady

texts.es:
Lady, de 21 años de edad, es una joven  mujer empeñosa y trabajadora, además de ser amable y cordial. Es soltera, y vive en compañía de su papá, mamá y sus 3 hermanas Claudia, Moli y Brenda de 19, 8 y 6 años de edad respectivamente a los que quiere mucho, habitando juntos la casa de sus padres. Las a actividad que realiza Lady, es la venta de ropas o prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros,  para lo cual realiza viajes periódicos cada 2 mes a la ciudad de Lima donde realiza sus compras buscando los mejores precios y modelos, para luego venderlos entre sus amistades de manera personal.  Además  también cuenta con un empleo en una empresa privada, donde ofrece sus productos  a sus compañeros de trabajo.
Realizando éste negocio desde hace más de 2 año iniciándose con un préstamo de MFP realizándola ella sola la venta y cobranzas. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de sus estudios superiores y la educación de su hermanas menores, de los cuales se siente orgullosa de apoyarlos en salir adelante, siendo futuros profesionales al servicio de la comunidad, logrando tener muchas satisfacciones gracias a su negocio, tiene los deseos de ampliar su negocio y hacerlo crecer. Este es el préstamo número 5 con la institución MFP. Por ello cuenta con su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse a gusto con banco comunal pues considera a  su grupo ser unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ropas de variados modelos traídos desde la capital, buscando los precios más bajos y así tener mayores ganancias, ya que cuenta con pedidos por entregar.
texts.en:
Lady, 21, is an enterprising, hardworking young woman in addition to being kind and cordial.  She’s single living with her father, mother and three sisters: Claudia, Moli and Brenda who are 19, 8, and 6 years of age respectively who she loves very much.  They all live together in her parents’ house.  

Lady’s activity is selling clothes for men and women.  To do so, she makes periodic trips to Lima twice a month to make her purchases always seeking the best prices and styles to then personally resell among her friends.  She also has a job in a private firm and sells her clothes to her coworkers there too.

She’s been in business two years having started with an MFP loan; she works doing the sales and collecting payments by herself.  She considers the business to be profitable because of the good profits it nets.

She likes her business because it generates income to cover her higher education costs as well as the education costs for her younger sisters; she feels proud to be able to help them get ahead and become future professionals in service of the community.  She gets much satisfaction from her business and wants to expand it and make it grow.  This is MFP loan #5 and she can count on collaboration to make her plans a reality.  Also, she feels comfortable as part of her group because she considers it to be united and supportive.

She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy assorted clothes in of various styles that she’ll bring from the capital looking for the lowest prices so profits will be higher since she has pending orders to fill.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Margarita Anthanuet

texts.es:
Margarita, trabaja en la venta de ropa nueva y usada vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de un año edad, este negocio lo aprendio por su madre, desde hace dos años trabaja en lo propio, su horario es de 8:00am hasta las 6:00pm, ademas ella aprovecha para vender recargas telefonicas de varias compañias.
Nos ha solicitado un crédito  el cual lo necesita para comprar dos fardos de ropa  calculados en un valor de $180 c/u haciendo un total de  $360, el crédito le ayudara en gran parte con un 90% de la inversion que desea realizar y a crecer en el negocio, sacar adelante a su familia dar el estudio a su hijo.
Los sueños son fortalecer el negocio y ayudarse con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Margarita has a business selling new and used clothing. She lives with her life partner and her son who is one year old. She learned how to run this business from her mom, and for the past two years has had her own business. Her work schedule is from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She takes advantage of the hours she is already working by selling phone cards of various cell phone companies during the same time.

She has requested a loan, which she needs to be able to buy two bundles of used clothing. The value of each bundle is estimated at $180, totaling $360 for both. The loan will help her pay for 90% of the investment  she wants to make, helping to grow her business which will help her family to get ahead and be able to pay for an education for her son. 

Her dreams are to strengthen her business and help with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es una mujer de 54 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven, Paulina no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho pode hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia. 
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su esposo, Paulina puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de comida y frituras, tales como pollo broaster, salchipollo y otros, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana ella inicia su labor, puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias, Paulina se siente a gusto en su negocio y cree que le va bien por su buena sazón y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Paulina se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina pequeña, así como mesas y sillas; de esta manera Paulina tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado para seguir trabajando, con ello espera aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda ampliar su negocio y así desea cumplir su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Paulina is a 54 year old woman and lives in the city of Nazca with her husband and their three children. She loves them and are her main purpose in life. She is a very friendly, hard working and enthusiastic person. With her husband they put their efforts in bringing their family forward. Unfortunately for a lack of economic resources and the need to work since she was very young, Paulina could not finish her primary school education but would have been very pleased to do so. In her free time she likes to relax listening to a little bit of music and on some occasions she cooks the delicious "Carapulcra con Sopa Seca" to share with her family. 

With much perseverance and enthusiasm and thanks to her husband's support, Paulina has set up her small business selling food and fried goods such as roasted chicken, chicken and hot dogs and others. Everyday she begins works at very early hours and works about 8 hours daily. Paulina is very pleased with her business and believes that it is going well for her because of the flavors she uses and the friendly manner she treats her clients. 

Paulina is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help provided, she will be able to buy a small kitchen, and tables and chair. In this way Paulina will have her business more suited to continue working. She hopes to increase her sales and income with the loan. This will serve her well so that in the not so distant future she can expand her business. She also hopes to fulfill her greatest dream of finishing the construction on her home.

loans.use: to buy a kitchen, a table and chairs.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 31 años, es una mujer laboriosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y su pequeña hija.
Ella se dedica a la venta de medicamentos desde hace 5 años, justo después de haber culminado con sus estudios. Para los pobladores de su localidad es una alegría visitar su farmacia, ya que son atendidos muy bien y sobre todo les brinda medicinas de calidad. Esta labor la efectúa sola, mientras que su pareja la apoya en el cuidado de su hija mientras está en su casa, ya que también tiene su propio trabajo. Lo que le resulta difícil es cuando se le terminan las medicinas y no tiene dinero para compara más, es por eso que acude a los préstamos.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente contenta por la oportunidad de este préstamo. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por permitirle formar parte.
Con estos 2,500 nuevos soles se abastecerá de medicinas para seguir implementando su farmacia.
texts.en:
Maritza is 31 years old. She is very hard working. She lives in her own house, along with her husband and their young daughter.

She has been selling medications for 5 years, which she started doing right after finishing her studies. Visiting her pharmacy is a happy occasion for the people in her town because they are well tended to and she provides quality medicines. She works by herself while her husband supports her by caring for their young daughter when he’s at home; he also has his own job. One of her difficulties is when the medicines sell out and she doesn’t have money to buy more. This is why she is applying for a loan.

This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is happy for this opportunity. She is also grateful to her communal bank for allowing her to be a part of it.

With these PEN 2,500.00 (nuevos soles), she will buy medicines so she can continue running her pharmacy.

loans.use: to stock more medicines so she can continue running her pharmacy.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children; all her children  go to school. She has two additional family members (elderly  parents). 

She operates a retail shop at the market.  She sells her products at retail. She has been in this  business for 10 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy sugar, box of soap, and carton of salt. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her goals and asipiration are to  buy to own a fully stocked retail shop and to buy a plot of land and build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water.  Her major expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more home products for her retail shop like sugar, salt and box of soap

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: María Lourdes, de 26 anos de edad, casada  responsables de dos hijos menores de edad de 6,4, anos respetivamente pertenece al departamento de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, Chinandega es una ciudad que se caracteriza por ser prospera en su actividad económica ya que es una ciudad fronteriza, ademas esta rodeado de sus municipios como chichigalpa el cual se caracteriza por su cana de azúcar, los ingenios, sus cultivos, sus hermosos paisajes. María Lourdes tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general la cual consisten en venta de ropa, calzado, cosméticos, y venta de sandias (la sandia es una fruta tropical) y venta de frijoles cosidos. La rutina de María Lourdes es de  aproximadamente unas 9 horas diarias con respeto a la distribución de mercadería  en general la cual hace de forma ambulante con clientes fijos y eventuales. Su rutina diaria es levantarse muy temprano para aprovechar la primeras horas del día ya que el sol no están tan fuerte, y su recorrido se hace menos pesado que por la tarde cuando el sol esta en todos su esplendor. Y la venta de sandias y frijoles cosido los tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella agradece el apoyo que los inversionistas kiva le brindad  a las mujeres trabajadoras y con pocos recursos, y de países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de vida digno. Gracias prestamista kiva. “vivan la Mujeres Nicaragüenses”
texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is 26 years old, married, and responsible for 2 young children, ages 6 and 4 respectively.  She is from the Department of Chinandega, located in the west of the country. Chinandega is a city known for its economic prosperity, since it is a frontier city. It is also surrounded by municipalities such as Chichigalpa, known for its sugar cane and sugar mills, as well as its beautiful landscapes. 

Maria Lourdes' economic activity is selling general merchandise, which consists of clothing, shoes, cosmetics, watermelon, and cooked beans. Her routine is approximately 9 hours daily selling general merchandise, which she does on foot with fixed or casual customers.

Maria Lourdes' daily routine is to rise very early to take advantage of the early hours of the day when the sun isn't so strong. Her task is made easier in the afternoon, when the sun is in all its splendor -- she sells watermelons and cooked beans from her home.

Maria Lourdes is grateful for the help offered by Kiva investors to women workers who lack resources, especially in poor countries like Nicaragua, helping them have a dignified life style. Thanks, Kiva lenders! And “Long live the Women of Nicaragua!”

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as a variety of clothing, shoes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rosalva

texts.es:
Rosalva, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, lociones, además a la siembra de maíz, es madre soltera tiene  cuatro hijos de 12, 11, 8,5, vive con su Mamá, tiene a todos sus hijos estudiando.
Ella emprendió el negocio debido a la necesidad de obtener ingresos, la venta la realiza de forma ambulante en los caseríos vecinos. Ha solicitado un crédito por que necesita invertir  en la agricultura sembrar una manzana de maíz, ella es una mujer emprendedora ella y sus dos hijos mayores hacen el cultivo. El crédito sera utilizado en la compra de insumos tales como: de abono, limpiar el terreno,además comprar  cosméticos para continuar en el negocio.
Cuáles son sus sueños: que sus hijos crezcan sanos y que tengan lo necesario para subsistir, que sus hijos sean profesionales y se ayuden mutuamente para salir adelante, tambien quiere crecer en el negocio y aumentar la producción de maíz.
texts.en:
Rosalva makes a living sells cosmetics and lotions and also plants corn. She is a single mother and has four children of 12, 11, 8 and 5 years of age. She lives with her mother and all her children are in school.

She began the business due to the need to have an income. She makes her sales by traveling in the nearby villages. She has requested a loan because she needs to invest in agriculture to plant about 1.74 acres of corn. She is an entrepreneurial woman. Her two oldest children and her grow the crops. The loan will be used to buy supplies including fertilizer, to clean her land and also to buy cosmetics to continue her business.

Her dreams are the following: that her children grow up healthy and have all that they need to live, that her children become professionals and help each other mutually to move forward. She also wants to grow the business and increase her corn production.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, clean her land and buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Nelson Vladimir

texts.es:
Nelson, trabaja en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, está acompañado, no tiene hijos y no tiene parientes en el extranjero, se dedica a dicha actividad desde hace doce años, lo aprendió de sus padres, trabaja todos los días dependiendo de la temporada agrícola.
Ha solicitado un crédito el cual lo necesita para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes, para  el cultivo de maíz y frijoles.
El prestamo le ayudara a comprar todos los insumos de una sola vez para la producción, así poder ayudar a su familia. El objetivo de Nelson es continuar  trabajando la tierra para  ayudar en el hogar
texts.en:
Nelson works cultivating corn and beans. He is in a relationship and does not have any children, and he does not have any relatives abroad. He has been in this line of work for two years. He learned it from his parents and he works every day, depending on the agricultural season.

He has requested a loan which he needs to buy manure and fertilizers in order to cultivate corn and beans. The loan will help him to buy all the supplies at once that he needs for production, and in this way he'll be able to help his family. Nelson's objective is to continue working the land to help his household.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells used clothes for men and women. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more used clothing, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and buy land. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house for her mother. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy used clothing to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama  is the woman scooping soup from the pot.  She operates a chop bar (where variety of African dishes are sold).   She has done this for 5 years.   The food she serves are fufu, banku and rice balls. She lives together with her husband and 2 dependents.   Ama uses her income to support her husband to pay their children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase foodstuff and other ingredients to prepare her food for sale. With the new profit, Ama plan to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a twenty-five-year-old man.  He is married to Ruth. He operates a motorcycle transportation business and also has a retail shop in Kimende on the outskirts of Limuru town. He has been in this business for ten years now and gets a monthly income of eighteen thousand KES.

This will be Peter's fourth loan with KADET LTD, he plans to use the loan to service the motorcycle and the rest of the money to buy things like rice, sugar, cooking fat, etc for his retail shop business. In the future he wants to be a businessman.

loans.use: service his motorbike and buy stock for his retail shop

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Due to cultural reasons Alaa prefers that her photo is not on the Internet, thus the above photo is of her husband. 

Alaa is a 23-year-old married woman who has 2 family members from Jarash Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for her home improvements -- she wants to repaint her home. In the future, she would like to improve her living standards.

Since Alaa is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Khen's Group

texts.en:
Khen is 31 years old and lives in a rural area in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia.  She has five children.  She earns a living through growing rice on one hectare of farmland, which she has been in for ten years to support her family.  This is the main source of the family’s income.  She is able to earn around 15,000 KHR per day and saves about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses for the future needs.

Khen’s group consists of four members.  She is leading her group to ask for a loan with VisionFund.   She is in her first loan with VisionFund.  Khen will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income in order to fulfill her dream to renovate her old house for living in.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Herlinda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Herlinda tiene 50 años es casada tiene hijos adultos.Herlinda empezó hace siete años vendiendo hielo en funda y bolos -jugos en fundas- y asi poco a poco fue prosperando hasta ofrecer mas productos tales como aliño. dulces , helados y jugos etc.

En la actualidad tiene su pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, en el momento que se le tomo la foto estaba re modelando su casa. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio, por eso quiere continuar con su tienda de viveres. Con el prestamo quiere comprar enlatados, dulces, arroz, maiz. Su sueño es incrementar su negocio y mejorar su vivienda
texts.en:
Herlinda is 50 years olds. She is married and has adult children. Herlinda began selling bags of ice and bags of juice seven years ago and little by little continued prospering to offer more products including dressing, sweets, ice cream, juices, etc.

She currently has her small house in the front part of her house. At the time that this photo was taken she was remodeling her house. She has many aspirations for her business and wants to continue with her store of basic products. With the loans she wants to buy canned goods, sweets, rice and corn. Her dream is to expand her business and make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy sweets, canned goods, rice and corn.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El comité  “kuña Aty, se encuentra en su primer ciclo, están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas, y se ayudan en todo lo que pueden, para que de esa forma salgan adelante con sus familias.
 Leonarda forma parte del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, como ser vinos, gaseosas, cervezas, etc. Cuenta que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene buen precio y buena calidad.
Leonarda solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas en general, para poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
The committee "kuña Aty" is in its first loan cycle and they are learning to work together. They help one another in any way they are able so that in this way they can get ahead along with their families.

Leonarda is part of this group and she works selling all kinds of beverages whether they be wine, sodas, beer, etc. She tells us that she has very good customers since she always has good prices and good quality.

Leonarda is requesting the loan to buy beverages in general, to be able to continue working and in this way support her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages for resale.

loans.name: Mwangi

texts.en:
Mwangi is a 72-year-old businessman. He is married to Rachael who is a farmer. They are blessed with nine children who are all adults. He has been running a retail shop for the past eleven years with the monthly income of KES. 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his third loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Njoroge will use the loan to add more stock of wheat flour, washing detergents, cooking fat and match boxes for sale. 


With the anticipated profit from the business, he will buy a plot. His hopes and dreams are to own a supermarket.

loans.use: to add more stock of wheat flour, washing detergents, cooking fat and match boxes for sale.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is 38 years old.  She is a food kiosk owner in Mombasa.  She is a widow and supports her three children who are aged 16, 12 and 3 years. She has been operating the food kiosk for the past three years with great success. She also runs a boutique to supplement her income.

This is Dorothy's first business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to renovate her kiosk and purchase more chairs and tables.  She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business further and pay her children’s school fees. She hopes to excel in the business and have a happy family.

loans.use: renovate her food kiosk and buy more chairs and tables

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married and has two children, both her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (brother and sister).  

Elizabeth has a business of selling charcoal.  She has applied for a loan of 2000000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal to resell. She has been in this business for four years and sells to all categories of people on retail.  She generates additional income through selling piped water and from rental houses.  

Elizabeth works seven days out of every week and works from her home.  Her major business challenges include transportation, seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to build more rental rooms and also to become a wholesaler.  She resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include  school fees, paying for utility bills and feeding the family.

loans.use: buy charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ngaakoom Group

texts.en:
Ngaakoom group is made up of 13 members who are all women with ages range from 31 to 46 years. They all live in the southern part of the township. Out of the 13, 12 are married with children and the remaining one is a single parent. They sell the following items:  provision, beans, fish, stationery, foodstuff, cutlery sets, fruits, second-hand clothing, sport kits and drinks. 

Samiria is 41 years old.  She is married to a 42-year-old who works in the civil service and they have 2 children who are schooling.  For the past 11 years, she runs a provision store and a drinking spot as her economic activity. Samiria’s business is doing very well and she is able to make monthly profits of about GH 120.  

Samiria is requesting her first loan from ID Ghana to purchase products such as Coca-Cola, soda, sachet water, and other non-alcoholic drinks. Her dream is to own a house and expand her business.

loans.use: buy beverages to sell

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is 39 years old, married to John, and a mother of three lovely children. She sells used clothes door to door and has been in this business for four years. Monicah gets a monthly income of 20,000 shillings.

This will be Monicah's first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more clothes for resale. In future she wants to own a shop and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
For the past seven years, Mwanarusi has been selling makuti (thatching materials made from palm fronds), selling them from her home. She is a married mother of three who are all attending school. 

Mwanarusi is asking for a loan from Yehu to buy more makuti for resale. This will help her to increase her income. She aims at expanding her business and hiring some employees later. Thanks for the support given.

loans.use: to buy more makuti (thatching materials made from palm fronds) for resale.

loans.name: Tupes

texts.en:
Tupes is 34 years old and married to Jane, and they are blessed with two children, age twelve and two years.  He has been in business of selling goats and sheep for one year and earns KES. 14,000 monthly.

This is Tupes' first loan from KADET LTD, and he will use it to purchase more goats and sheep for fattening, and sell them later at a profit. 

With the anticipated revenue this will generate, Tupes plans to expand his business and educate his children. His dream is to provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase more goats and sheep for fattening and sell later.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has owned a retail shop in Nyahururu town for the last four years. She is 28 years old and married to Robert, and they have been blessed with two children.

Jane has a retail shop which she has been running for the past four years. She plans to use this loan amount to buy more stock of sugar, rice, bar soap and cooking fat. This will enable her to serve her clients well and also meet their demands.

In the future, Jane hopes to expand her business and open a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, rice, bar soap and cooking fat.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en: For ten years, Isabella has been in the farming business, including cash crops and poultry keeping, supporting her family on a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). She is applying for her fifth loan of KES. 100,000 with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. Isabella will use this loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm, so as to improve her cash crops. With the anticipated profit from the business, Isabella will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to export her farm produce and improve the family's living standard.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer for her farm,

loans.name: Nani

texts.en:
Nani is from a small village in Terjola district. She is 41 years old, married, and lives with her children (11 and 13 years old) and a mother-in-law, who is a pensioner. The children go to the local school. 

Nani's family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they own a plot of land where nuts are grown. They have a vineyard as well. The family does all relevant seasonal work to insure a good harvest. Nani picks the nuts and grapes and sells locally. She is also involved in a dairy farm. She has 2 milk cows whose milk is used for cheese products.  Nani sells the cheese in the nearby villages.   She works hard, but still doesn’t have enough income to make some savings and improve the living conditions for her family.  

Nani has applied for this loan to increase the number of cattle and get connected to a gas supply. With the requested loan she plans to purchase a milk cow. This will allow Nani to receive more milk for her dairy and increase the sales which provide her main income. This will give her an opportunity to reinvest in her agricultural business. After the gas is provided, the family will be able to improve their living conditions.  She awaits your support.

loans.use: buy a milk cow and get connected to a gas supply

loans.name: Angelica Maria

texts.es:
Angelica se dedica a la venta de tomate, cebolla, papas en una carreta ambulantemente en las calles de Guayaquil. 
Este negocio era de su mama y por motivos de continuar con el negocio se lo dejo a ella ya que era muy rentable y seguro y le daba tiempo para atender a sus hijos. 

Sigue trabajando con esfuerzo y dedicacion todos los dias, su trabajo  lo hace sola desde las 6:00am hasta las 12:00pm. Es madre soltera tiene 1 hijo de 9 años, con el prestamo va a comprar legumbres para seguir vendiendo. 
Unas de sus metas es tener un local propio y mejorar el estado de su casa.
texts.en:
Angelica sells tomatoes, onions, and potatoes in a cart as a vendor on the streets of Guayaquil.

This was her mother's business. In order to continue with the business she left it to Angelica, since it was already very profitable and secure and it gave her time to care for her children.

She continues working hard and with dedication every day. She works alone from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 p.m. She is the single mother of one nine-year-old son. With the loan, she is going to buy vegetables in order to keep selling.

Some of her goals are to have her own shop and improve the condition of her house.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Mayi

texts.en:
Mayi lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members (her aunt’s daughter and two orphans). She lives in her own house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Mayi sells Airtime in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 2,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy jewelry and Airtime. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children to university level and to become a wholesaler of Airtime.

loans.use: To buy more Airtime
