loans.name: Ketty

texts.en:
Ketty is a 42-year-old widow. She has one daughter, in addition to two dependants who are both orphans.

She started the business in 2007 after her husband had just passed on, so that she could sustain her family and pay school fees for her daughter. She will use this particular loan to buy more stock for the retail shop in the form of salt, soap, sugar and other household  items. 

Her main challenge is limited capital, creditors who fail to pay at times, and also stiff competition from other retailers. 

Ketty is further challenged by the high interest rates on loans, which affect her profit margin, leaving her with little to save. She thinks that if she ever saves enough she will do away with loans.

loans.use: To buy soap, salt, sugar and other daily household items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sharifeh

texts.en:
Sharifeh is a 29-year-old single woman from Jarash Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to buy cosmetic products and accessories to resell to her friends and neighbors in the same of area. In the future she would like to expand her project to increase her income.

Since Sharifeh is under 30 year old her loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products and accessories to resell

loans.name: Marie

texts.en: Marie is 39 years old, married, and lives in Compound #3 with her five children between 12 to 23 years old, who are in school. For twelve years she has been selling bread in her community. She likes the way customers respond to her business, and she learned this way of selling from her mother. Marie is requesting this loan to buy more bread for her business. In the future she wants to send her children on for higher education.

loans.use: to buy more bread for her business.

loans.name: Maricela Paulina

texts.es:
Maricela  es una mujer sencilla  de 26 años que vive a su esposo Marcos  y su hijo de 2 años; ella vive en Santo Domingo.
Santo Domingo es la cuarta ciudad más poblada del Ecuador, está ubicada en la región costa y es un punto de enlace entre las ciudades más grandes del Ecuador (Quito y Guayaquil), posee un clima cálido y alberga grandes organismos culturales, financieros, administrativos y comerciales.
Hace más o menos 2 años inicio su negocio en  la crianza de cerdos  para la venta,  con el propósito de ayudar  a su esposo  económicamente, ya que en ocasiones su esposo no cuenta con ingresos,  por motivos que trabaja independientemente como estibador.
Maricela  es una mujer visionaria y con  este crédito que solicita, piensa  invertirlo en la construcción de galpones para las chanceras, ya que de esta manera mantendría a sus animales más limpios y  protegidos para la venta y así aumentaría  sus ganancias y creer en este negocio. 
Le gusta esta actividad ya que le queda tiempo para criar y educar a su pequeño hijo.
texts.en:
Mariela is 26 years old. She is a modest woman who lives with her husband Marcos and their two-year-old son in Santo Domingo.

Santo Domingo is the fourth most populated city in Ecuador. It is located in the coastal region of the country and stands as a point of connection between the largest cities in Ecuador, Quito and Guayaquil. Its climate is warm and it is home to great cultural, financial, administrative, and commercial institutions.

Approximately two years ago, she started a business raising pigs for sale in order to help her husband financially, since there are times when he doesn't have any income because he is self-employed. He works as a longshoreman.

Mariela is a visionary woman and she plans to use the loan she is requesting to invest in building sheds over her pigpens. This will allow her to keep the animals she sells cleaner and better protected, so that her profit may increase and her business expand.

She enjoys her work, because it allows her time to raise and care for her young child.

loans.use: to build sheds over her pigpens.

loans.name: Umidjon

texts.ru: Умидджону 28 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка, которому 9 месяцев. Он вырос в бедной семье. Отец работал в колхозе, а мать сидела дома и занималась воспитанием детей. Умидджон учился до 9 класса. После окончания 9 класса он начал работать грузчиком. 8 лет назад начал свой бизнес скотоводством. У него большой огород, где выращивает сено для скота. Он продает молоко своим соседям и соседи очень довольны от полученного натурального молочного продукта. Еще он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Умидджон хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает кредит на сумму  3000  сомони для покупки 2 теленка, чтобы развевать бизнес. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Umidjon is 28 years old.  He is married and raising one child, who is nine months old.  He grew up in a poor family.  His father worked at a collective farm, and mother stayed home and raised children.  Umidjon went to school until the ninth grade.  After completing ninth grade, he started working as a loader.  He started his own business in animal husbandry eight years ago.  He has a large garden, where he grows hay for the livestock.  He sells milk to his neighbors, who are very happy with the natural milk product.  He also sells livestock that he looks after for several months.  He has many clients at the market.  Umidjon wants to develop his business, but does not have sufficient means to do so.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy two calves in order to develop his business.  He relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy two calves in order to develop his business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 60 años, es una mujer buena y muy trabajadora, está casada hace muchos años con Abertano y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y su nieta de 14 años a quien le otorga todo lo necesario e intenta brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Mercedes consiste en la venta de carbón. Realiza este oficio en su casa, ahí instala una mesa en donde coloca las bolsas de carbón que previamente a distribuido de manera similar en bolsas pequeñas. Inicialmente compra al por mayor, en sacos que le producen mas de 50 bolsas pequeñas que luego ella pone a la venta. Compra aproximadamente 5 sacos por semana invirtiendo alrededor de 100 soles en cada compra,  lleva en este negocio más de 4 años y le va muy bien. Complementa este negocio vendiendo en algunas ocasiones productos regionales como plátanos y limones. Recibe el apoyo de su nieta y a veces también le ayuda su esposo. Le gusta su trabajo porque puede generar sus propios ingresos en la comodidad de su hogar, está pendiente de las labores que tiene que realizar en su casa y ha aprendido a complementar muy bien ambas funciones, sin embargo aun no se siente satisfecha económicamente, es por eso que desea establecer un nuevo negocio que consiste en la venta de frutas, para ello ya tiene un puesto ubicado en la zona céntrica de la ciudad, ahora anhela implementarlo con las más ricas y deliciosas frutas de la región y del país y de esta forma espera incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el préstamo número 6 con la institución MFP. Es por eso que agradece a quienes hacen posible este financiamiento que le ayudará a cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará 5 sacos de carbón y algunos racimos de plátano para venderlos en este período, el monto restante del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de distintas frutas tropicales como uva, manzana, pera, chirimoya, naranjas, sandía y otros con los implementará su nuevo negocio.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 60 years old. She is a good, hard working woman. She has been married to Albertano for many years. She lives in her own home with her husband and her grand daughter who is 14 years old, to whom she provides for all her needs and tries to give her a better quality of life. 

Mercedes has a business selling coal. She runs the business out of her home. She has a table set up where she puts the bags of coal, which previously she has portioned out into smaller bags. Initially she purchased wholesale, buying sacks that could make more than 50 small bags, which she then sold. She buys approximately 5 sacks a week, investing around 100 soles in each purchase. She has had this business for more than 4 years and it is going very well. Along with this business, she also sometimes sells local products like plantains and lemons. Her grand daughter helps her with the business, and also sometimes her husband. She likes her work because she is able to make her own income from the comfort of her own home, and also be able to do the chores that need to be done around the house. She has learned how to keep a balance between her business and taking care of the house. However, she is still not satisfied with her economic situation, which is why she wants to start a new business selling fruit. She already has a location to sell from, located in the downtown area of the city. She wants to sell the most tasty and delicious of the region and of the country, and in this way hopes to increase her income. This is the sixth loan she has taken out through MFP. She is thankful to the people who make these loans possible, which help her to reach her goals. She also said that she feels content with her community bank, because she knows the members and considers them to be responsible and supportive people.    

With the loan of 2000 soles, Mercedes will buy 5 sacks of coal and a few bunches of bananas to sell during this time, the rest of the loan she will invest in the purchase of various tropical fruits like grapes, apples, pears, custard apples, oranges, watermelons and others to start her new business with.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of coal and various fruits.

loans.name: Susar

texts.ru:
Сусар 50 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Сусар в качестве основного  дохода занимается пошивом верхней и легой одежды, начав этот бизнес в 1998 году с суммы в 5,000 сом. Благодаря стилю и  высокому качеству исполнения одежды, Сусар смогла наработать постоянных клиентов из танцевальных групп и и музыкального училища. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сусар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 35,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку материала для пошива.  Доходы от кредита Сусар планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса за счет покупки еще одной машинки, а в будущем хотела бы открыть ателье.
texts.en: Susar is 50 years old, married and has three children.  To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in sewing outerwear and light clothing, having started this business in 1998 with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to style and high quality of produced clothing, Susar was able to have regular customers from dance groups and music college.  In order to further develop her business, Susar requested a loan in the amount of 35,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase materials for sewing.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into a further business growth by buying another sewing machine and wants to open an atelier in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for sewing

loans.name: Agustina Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Agustina del Socorro,   es una persona negociante y enérgica, teniendo como actividad venta de ropa nueva, sale a vender ambulante semanalmente a los departamentos del país, tiene su clientela fija a los cuales visita constantemente.en la foto la observamos con parte de su mercadería que vende.

 Solicita el  préstamo a nuestra institución para invertir en su vivienda,  comprara materiales para el reforzamiento de un muro, Esto con el propósito de asegurar su casa, que en esta ocasión es la necesidad de repararlo ya que esta incompleto, debido a que en el futuro le cueste más invertir en la reparación de este. El crédito anterior lo utilizo para comprar más mercadería (ropa nueva variada).  Se siente agradecida con ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por medio de los préstamos ha incrementado su negocio y le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda y tener  una mejor condición  de vida  para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Agustina del Socorro is an energetic businessperson. She sells new clothing. She goes out weekly to sell as a street vendor in the country's departments. She has her loyal clientele, which she visits constantly. In the photo we see her with some of the merchandise she sells.

She is asking our institution for the loan in order to invest in her house. She will purchase materials to reinforce a wall with the goal of securing her house. The wall currently needs to be repaired since it is incomplete, because in the future it will cost her more to repair it. She used the previous loan to purchase more merchandise (a variety of new clothing). She is thankful to Ceprodel and Kiva for the opportunity and the confidence placed in her. Through the loans, she has increased her business, and it has allowed her to improve her house and have better living conditions for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials to reinforce a wall in her house

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Leonarda, ahora tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia se dedica a la   ganadería, principalmente a la venta de leche de vaca, además de esto, ella también se dedica a la a la crianza de animales menores como cerdos, gallinas y cuyes.
Leonarda invertirá su préstamo solicitado para comprar alimento como afrecho, forraje y chala para sus animales.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Leonarda pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Leonarda is now 36 years old. She is a single mother and has 2 children. They live in the district of Tambo Real in the province of Anta. She works in cattle farming, mainly selling cow’s milk, besides this, she also breeds small animals such as pigs, chickens and guinea pigs. Leonarda will invest her loan to buy food like bran, fodder and corn husk for her animals.

Leonarda is very grateful to KIVA for helping her develop her activity and she promises to fulfill her payments by the deadline. Leonarda belongs to a communal bank “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” in the district of Tambo Real in the province of Anta in Cusco-Peru.

loans.use: to buy food for her animals.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Sebastiana, ahora tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos,  vive en el distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta, la socia se sigue dedicando a la   producción y venta  lácteos como leche, queso y yogurt. Sebastiana necesita más leche para elaborar sus productos, por ello invertirá su préstamo solicitado en  comprar más leche.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas puntualmente. Sebastiana pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” distrito de Tambo Real de la provincia de Anta en Cusco – Perú.
Sebastiana quiere proporcionarles una mejor vida y educación a sus hijos,  y por ellos se sacrifica, así que espera trabajar mucho y ahorrar para invertir en la educación de ellos.
texts.en:
Sebastiana is now 52 years old. She is married and has 6 children. She lives in the district of Tambo Real in the province of Anta. She continues in the buying and selling of dairy such as milk, cheese and yogurt. Sebastiana needs more milk to make her products and she will invest her requested loan to buy more milk.

She is very grateful to KIVA for helping her develop in her activity and promises to comply and be punctual with the monthly payments. Sebastiana belongs to a communal bank “San Bartolo de Tambo Real” in the district of Tambo Real in the province of Anta de Cusco-Peru.

Sebastiana wants to provide a better life and education for her children. And for them she sacrifices. She hopes to work hard and save to invest in their education.

loans.use: to buy milk.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
René, vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hija quien aun es dependiente económicamente. El se dedica a una panadería que está bien ubicada para los clientes, este trabajo lo aprendió hace mucho tiempo.
Ha tomado la decision de solicitar ayuda financiera, el cual lo invertirá para la compra de harina, azúcar, huevos, leche, esencia de venilla, jalea, margarina, tambien Pagara la mano de obra ya que tiene personas que le colaboran en esta actividad, manifiesta que su objetivo es pagar este préstamo con las ganancias, tener la oportunidad de mejorar su produccion.
texts.en:
René lives in his own home with his life partner and his daughter, who is still financially dependent. He works in a bakery that is well located for his customers.  He learned this profession a long time ago.
He made the decision to apply for financial aid, which will be invested in the purchase of flour, sugar, eggs, milk, vanilla extract, jelly, margarine. He will also use it to pay labor, as he has many people helping him with his work. He stated his goal is to repay the loan with the business proceeds and to have the opportunity to improve production.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, eggs, milk, vanilla extract, jelly, margarine.

loans.name: Tekla

texts.en:
Tekla is 42 years old and married with five children. She has been in the bakery business for the last six years, earning approximately KES 30,000 monthly. She is also engaged in a milk selling business for additional income. 

This is Tekla's first loan from KADET LTD.  She borrowed KES 100,000 and plans to use some of it on purchasing baking flour and cooking oil for her  bakery and the remaining amount on renovating the bakery shop. 

With the anticipated profits Tekla plans to use it in repaying her loan and the remaining amount in running her business. She hopes to expand her bakery business.

loans.use: buy ingredients and renovate her bakery

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 39 years old and married with four children. She has been in the cereals business for the last seven years.  She also sells food during market days for additional income. On a monthly basis she can earn approximately KES 35,000 from her businesses. 

This is Irene’s seventh loan with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loans. She borrowed KES 100,000 and plans to use it on purchasing dry maize for resale. 

With the anticipated profits Irene plans to use it in repaying her loan and the remaining amount for her children’s education. She hopes to expand on her cereals business.

loans.use: buy maize to resell

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is married to Ali and together they have six children to take care of. They live in the coastal region of Kenya in a small town by the city of Mombasa. Thanks for their cooperation, they sit to share ideas. 

Three years ago, Binti decided to start a food stall in her vicinity to help her spouse in catering for their household expenses. Binti is well known for her cheap and high quality food which helps her win many customers and outshine her competitors. 

Demand for more varieties of food has risen but Binti narrates that she does not have enough capital to increase her ingredients and neither does her spouse. For this reason then, she is requesting for a loan from Kiva through Yehu so as to buy kitchenware, wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, etc.

loans.use: buy supplies to make food for sale

loans.name: Smile Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 56-year-old married man and a member of the Smile group. He has been operating a drinking spot where he sells softdrinks and fruit drinks at his resident for about 8 years now.

Emmanuel joined his group in 2009 and since 2010 ID-Ghana has supported him financially. This is his fifth loan cycle and he needs Kiva’s support of 500 Ghana cedis to help him increase his stock. The profits from his business will go toward savings, food, and supporting his grandchildren's education.

loans.use: buy softdrinks to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a woman of forty-five years.  She is married to George and supports three people in her house. She lives in Kimende on the outskirts of Limuru town.   She does farming and has been farming for ten years now.  Lydia gets a monthly income of eighteen thousand shillings.

This will be Lydia's fourth loan with KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan on her farm. In the future, she wants to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Nulu

texts.en:
Nulu is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with five children, two of her children go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members(mother and father). 

Nulu knits sweaters and table cloths in a shop that she rents. She sells her products on a wholesale basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week.  

Nulu has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 2,000,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy threads, needles and also acquire another knitting machine.  Nulu also generates additional income through working as a director of Makerere Aids Widows Association (MAWDA). Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children up to university level and to acquire more machines for knitting sweaters. 

Nulu lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: buy a knitting machine and knitting supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old and  lives in Kakata with her husband and four children.  Her husband serves as a principal.  Her children are between the ages of 9 and 24, and are currently in school.  

Mary has been selling plantains, palm oil, dry meat, and pepper in the community market for the past nine years. She was taught to sell by her mother.   She faces some difficulties in the raining season where there is less sales. With the profit generated from the business, she buy more goods and help with the expenses of her family.  

Mary has requested a loan to purchase more dry meat, palm oil, and plantains to increase her sales.  Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: buy dry meat, palm oil, plantains to resell

loans.name: Altyn

texts.ru:
Алтын 40 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей. Алтын в качестве основного дохода с 1992 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 6,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Алтын в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 дойные коровы, 2 бычка, 1 лошадь, 10 овец. Также, Алтын обрабатывает 0,40 га земли с эспарцетом и картофелем. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алтын обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота – молодняка для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Алтын планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины, и на следующий год отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Altyn is 40 years old, married and has three children.  To provide the primary source of income, she has been involved in animal husbandry since 1992, having started this business with a sum of 6,000 som.  Thanks to Altyn's hard work, today her business contains two dairy cows, two bulls, one horse and ten sheep.  She also works on 0.40 hectares of land with sainfoin and potatoes.  In order to further develop her business, Altyn requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy young livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities and repairing her house next year.

loans.use: to buy young livestock for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru:
Назокат проживает в районе Шахритус. Она 30 - летняя замужняя женщина. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж работает строителем. 
Назокат имеет среднее образование. Она после окончания школы вышла замуж, занималась домашним хозяйством. Ее муж обеспечивал и обеспечивает свою семью. Но со временем дети становятся взрослыми и потребности соответственно увеличиваются. Одному человеку (мужу Назокат) становится трудно зарабатывать и обеспечивать семью всеми необходимыми. 
На сегодняшний день Назокат решила заняться животноводством у себя дома. Таким образом она намерена получить дополнительный доход и вместе с мужем обеспечивать семью. Назокат берет кредит для закупа телят, коз и овец.
texts.en: Nazokat lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is a 30 year-old married woman, who has four children.  Her husband works as a construction worker.  Nazokat has a secondary education.  She got married after finishing school and has been involved in household work.  Her husband provided and continues to provide for the family, but with time, the children grow up, and the needs increase accordingly.  It becomes difficult for one person (Nazokat's husband) to earn money and provide the family with all of the necessities.  Today, Nazokat decided to get involved in animal husbandry at home.  She intends to earn an additional income and provide for the family together with her husband.  Nazokat is requesting this loan to buy calves, goats and sheep.

loans.use: to buy calves, goats and sheep

loans.name: Mwanarusi

texts.en:
Rosa is 22 years old.  She has two children. She lives in her own home in a very calm neighborhood.

Rosa earns a living operating a food stall selling to the neighborhood. She has a good customer base and has reasonable prices.  She has requested a loan to buy kitchenware and furniture. She dreams of owning a hotel in the future.

loans.use: buy kitchenware and furniture

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony is 29 years old and single.  He is in the cereals business and has been in operation for the last three years, earning KES 7,000 monthly. This is Tony’s first loan of KES 20,000.  He will use it to purchase dry beans and maize for resale.  With the anticipated profits, he plans to use it on finishing the rental houses he had started constructing. His hope is that he’ll be independent financially.

loans.use: buy dry beans and maize for resale

loans.name: Hekri

texts.en:
Hekri is a Romani man from the ethnically vulnerable minority community of central eastern Albania.  He is in his mid-fifties and married with six children.  In the last twenty years his involvement has been in selling confections in the streets and he has been enjoying it, just like many others in his community.  In addition to what he is selling, Hekri is the only one in the city, according to him, to repair specific motor vehicles that only people in his community use.  He claims that with that with the profit he has gained through it, he has been able to raise his children by giving them the very basics.

Hekri now is applying for a loan for the first time to buy more cotton/woven fabric raw materials that very soon will be in demand because of the fall/winter season.   He claims to be very responsible, thus potential lenders should feel at ease in case they lend to him.

loans.use: buy fabric to resell

loans.name: Tong's Group

texts.en: Tong is a 57-year-old mother of seven children, only one of whom is living with her because she can earn only a low income from her sugarcane juice selling business. To support their daily basic needs, Tong grows rice and plants vegetables (green mustard). She has been in this business for 32 years and is able to earn about 29,000 KHR per day and save her about 7,000 KHR per day after offsetting the daily expenses. She formed a group of three members who all are the first-time loan clients. They are applying for 800,000 KHR each, Tong is the group leader. She will use her loan portion to buy green mustard seeds, fertilizer, and insecticide for her rice field and vegetable garden. She hopes to grow a healthy cash-crop so she can multiple her income for her children's sake.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticide

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca, 47 years old, lives in Cabisera 7. She is married and has two children, 7 and 18 years old, both in school and living at home. Francisca's husband is a farmer. 

For the past ten years, Francisca has been running a provisions shop, selling rice, soap, toothpaste, oil, tissues, milk, batteries, and many other items. She says that some of the problems she faces are the shop location and having fewer commodities. She learned this way of business from her mother and started it with her help. Francisca is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000 to purchase more inventory (rice, soap, toothpaste, oil, tissues, milk, batteries, and many other items) for her shop. She says that she is happy about her business for so many reasons: it keeps her busy, it builds her trust, and it makes her well-known (everyone in her community looks up to her for help if the community needs it). Francisca smiles as she says her plan is to expand her business and empower others with her business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, soap, toothpaste, oil, tissues, milk, batteries, and many other items for her shop

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 53 years of age, married to Eduardo, and has three grown children. She is a hard-working and caring woman.

Estrella has a farm of citrus trees, with about 220 mature trees. She started this business in 2007. Estrella would like to make her plantation more productive to be able to have a stable income, which will serve her family's needs and improve their living condition. Aside from the plantation, she also has 500 square meters of rice fields and has a backyard vegetable garden. Estrella really enjoys her daily routine. 

She plans to buy fertilizer and insecticides to avoid any diseases that could affect the growth of her citrus trees. For this reason, she asks for a loan of PHP5,000. She believes that she will strengthen her citrus plantation and increase her harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides for her citrus plantation

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes, de 67 años, es una mujer alegre y con muchas ganas de vivir, está casada con Ulises, tiene 5 hijos mayores de edad y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, su hija y sus dos nietos a quienes cría con mucho amor y desea brindarles la mejor calidad de vida para que tengan un futuro sin complicaciones económicas. El trabajo de Lourdes consiste en la venta de golosinas, tiene una vitrina en su casa en donde ofrece al público diversas galletas, chicles, caramelos y otros productos que solicitan sus clientes como pequeños antojos. Trabaja en esta actividad hace 5 meses. Esta función lo realiza paralelamente a la venta de comida, tiene algunas mesas y sillas que diariamente instala en la vereda de su casa, para ello recibe la ayuda de sus nietos e hijos quienes le ayudan a ubicar las mesas en el horario establecido y en ocasiones le apoyan en la atención mientras ella se dedica a asar algunas carnes, pescados y plátanos con los que elabora los platillos que ofrece a la venta. Lleva 2 años trabajando en este negocio, durante éste tiempo ha ido afinando su sazón y mejorando la atención de sus clientes. Le gusta su oficio porque le permite estar en continua actividad física al mismo tiempo que genera los ingresos económicos que cubren los gastos de su hogar, desea seguir trabajando y más adelante continuar con el progreso de su negocio ya sea con una bodega en donde venda mayor cantidad de golosinas y algunos abarrotes o ampliando y mejorando a infraestructura del lugar donde vende sus potajes. Este es el préstamo número 3 con MFP, por ello agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de cuotas de manera puntual, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya ha observado que todos sus integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará algunas golosinas como galletas, caramelos y chocolates, así mismo comprará ingredientes, insumos y algunos utensilios para continuar vendiendo comida y atender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 67 years old. She is a joyful woman and full of life. She is married to Ulises and has five adult children. She lives in the house she owns with her husband, their daughter, and their two grandchildren. She is raising them very lovingly and wants to provide them with the best quality of life so that they have a future with no financial problems. 

Lourdes' work is selling sweets. She has a display case at home where she offers the public cookies, gum, candy, and other products that her customers ask for, such as small snacks. She has been in this business for five months and combines it with selling food. She has some tables and chairs that she puts out on the sidewalk in front of her house daily. Her children and grandchildren help her set them up on schedule and occasionally they help her tend to the customers while she cooks some of the meat, fish, and plantains she uses to make the dishes she sells. She has been in this business for two years, and during this time she has honed her cooking skills and improved her customer service. She likes her job because it allows her to stay physically active and, at the same time, generate financial income to cover home expenses. She wants to keep working and continue advancing her business in the future, be it by having a store selling larger quantities of sweets and some groceries or by expanding and improving the infrastructure of her food business. 

This is her third loan with MFP, so she is grateful to all of the people who make these loans possible so that she can realize her plans. On the other hand, she promises to pay her installments on time. She is also very happy to belong to her communal bank and has seen how very responsible and supportive her fellow members are.

She will use the requested amount, 1,500 soles, to purchase some sweets like cookies, candy, and chocolates, and she will also buy ingredients, supplies, and some utensils to continue selling food and serve her customers more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase sweets like cookies, candy, and chocolates, supplies and some utensils.

loans.name: Hut's Group

texts.en:
Hut, aged 59, is a farmer mainly in growing rice and living in Sangke district of Battambang province. Besides working on his rice farm, which is his main source of income, he also catches fish which he sells to earn an extra income to support his children. He has eight children in total, seven of whom have their own employment whilst the remaining one daughter is a student. He has been in business for 10 years, earning about 31,000 KHR per day and saving about 10,500 KHR per day after offsetting daily expenses. 

This is Hut's fifth loan cycle with VisionFund, Kiva's partner. He has smartly used his previous loans with success in order to obtain better living conditions for his family. Now, he is joining a group consisting of three members to take out a new loan. Hut, as group leader, is going to use his loan portion to pay  plowing fees and some part of it to buy a small boat to support his fish-catching business. He hopes this loan will enable him to double his income and expand his business so that he can upgrade his lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay for plowing fee and buy a small boat.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a business-oriented woman. She currently manages her direct selling, frozen foods and carinderia (mini-restaurant) business. She has been running her direct selling business for 20 years, her frozen food business for five years, and her carinderia business for two years.

Eliza puts her profits toward the daily maintenance of her hogs, daily household needs, and the improvement of her carinderia. She aims to increase the cosmetic products she offers to her direct selling and improve her production sales business. She hopes to attain her goals in her life and also with her business. She is asking for a loan amount of PHP 15,000 to allow her to buy additional cosmetic products and be able to increase the kilograms of her frozen foods. In addition, she will use some of the loan to buy meat and vegetables for her carinderia. She knows that through improving her production sales and increasing the stocks of her cosmetic products, she will be able to increase her income. In this way, she will be able to improve her living condition and save some money for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional products for her direct selling and production sales business

loans.name: Rahbar

texts.ru: Рахбар начала свое сотрудничество с нашей организации с 2011 года.   Она шьет на дому "курпачи", национальные матрацы. Этим делом ее научила мама, теперь она сама продолжает и помогает матери производить "курпачи".   Рахбар также работает в ресторане официанткой, она старается заработать больше так как дети подросли и надо готовиться к поступлению детей в Университет и копить на свадьбу сына и дочери.   У Рахбар 4 детей, муж Рахбар также усердно  трудиться в РТ.   Рахбар хочет получить кредит для  приобретение ваты, для того чтобы производить национальные матрасы нужна вата.   По нашим традициям когда женят или выдают дочку замуж в обязательном порядке на приданное дают национальные матрацы. Сейчас у нее сезон, все готовятся на свадьбу, и заказывают  у Рахбар эти курпачи(национальные матрацы).На полученный кредит планирует закупить вату.   Заранее благодарит.
texts.en: Rahbar started her partnership with our organization in 2011.  She sews "kurpachi" or national mattresses at home.  Her mother taught her this business, and now Rahbar continues it herself and helps her mother to make "kurpachi."  Rahbar also works as a waitress at a restaurant.  She tries to earn more because her children grew up, and she needs to get ready for them to start a university and save money for her son's and daughter's weddings.  Rahbar has four children, and her husband works hard as well.  She wants to obtain this loan to purchase cotton in order to make national mattresses.  According to our traditions, when a daughter gets married, her dowry must include national mattresses.  Currently, it is the season when everyone is getting ready for weddings and order these kurpachi (national mattresses) from Rahbar.  She plans to use this loan to buy cotton and is grateful in advance.

loans.use: to purchase cotton in order to make national mattresses

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en: Concepcion is 46 years old, married, and has six children. She is engaged in a hog-fattening business. Right now, Concepcion wants to barrow a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase feed and vitamins. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further grow her business. This would enable her to offer her family a better way of living.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins

loans.name: Renerio

texts.en:
Renerio is married with 6 children. Renerio is 64 years old and lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

To earn a living, Renerio owns a tailoring business. He has had this business for 29 years. Each month, he earns approximately 15,000 PHP. He has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP for additional capital his tailoring business. Renerio has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.

In the future, Renerio hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth and threads

loans.name: Ana Antonia

texts.es: Ana  es originaria de waspan municipio ubicado en la región autónoma atlántica del norte del país actualmente vive en Granada. Ella tiene 58 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos mayores de edad y es comerciante. Es propietaria de una pulpería en la que vende productos de consumo básicos desde hace 10 años. Ella inicio su propio negocio atravez de su esposo quien puso un taller  y venta de repuestos mecánicos y como el local del taller era grande decidieron dividirlo y ahí puso ella  su pulpería, además vende frijoles cosidos y chicha en botella, bebida típica hecha a base de maíz fermentado, azúcar, canela, clavos de olor, vainilla y hielo, la cual es muy solicitada debido a su bajo costo y es parte de la cultura ancestral ingerir esta bebida típica tradicional. Ana solicita un crédito kiva para invertir en  granos básicos tales como: arroz y frijoles, azúcar, maíz, aceite, comprar botellas para vender la chicha y así  tener más de estos productos en inventario y vender más. Tiene como  planes futuros ampliar mas su pulpería agregando nuevos productos y de esta manera ir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is a native of Waspan, a town located in the North Atlantic Autonomous Region of the country, and currently lives in Granada.  She's 58 years old and married, has four adult children, and is a merchant.  She owns a local store where she has sold basic supplies for 10 years.

She began her own business through her husband, who set up a shop and store for machine parts.  The space was big, so they decided to divide it and she set up her grocery store there.  She also sells cooked beans and bottled "chicha," a typical beverage made from fermented corn, sugar, cinnamon, clove, vanilla, and ice that is in demand because it's cheap and because it's part of the ancestral culture to drink this traditional beverage.

Ana is requesting a Kiva loan to buy basic supplies such as rice, beans, sugar, corn, oil, and bottles to sell the chicha.  This way she'll have more of these products in stock and sell more.

Her plan for the future is to expand her store more, adding new products to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, corn, oil, and bottles

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Mujeres Unidas es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, se encuentra en el 6º ciclo con 20 integrantes, son señoras trabajadoras que se esmeran en progresar. Se dedican a variadas actividades, pero también se ayudan las unas a las otras para salir adelante.
La Sra. Ramona cuenta que con esfuerzo trabaja como empleada doméstica y también se dedica a la venta de comestibles con la intención de tener mayores ingresos, nos dice que trabajando es la única forma que una persona tiene para salir adelante y ser alguien en la vida.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los alimentos que vende. Está muy contenta por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mujeres Unidas is from the city of Carapeguá. It is in its sixth cycle and has twenty members who are all hard-working women who do their best to make progress. They work in different businesses, but they also help each other get ahead.

Ramona says she works with effort as a domestic, and she also works selling food products so that she can have more income. She tells us that work is the only way a person can move forward in life and be someone.

She is requesting the loan to purchase meat, vegetables, spices, and other ingredients so that she can keep making the food she sells. She is very happy with the opportunity she is being given.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, spices, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Juan Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Juan Miguel  está soltero, tiene 22 años de edad, cursó los grados de educación diversificada, esta graduado de una carrera, se dedica al tejido de cortes y sabanas, inicio este negocio con el apoyo de su papa, y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de materia prima, para aumentar su producción de tejidos, va a comprar materia prima consistente en hilos de diferentes colores, espera tener en el futuro un negocio posicionado y con mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juan Miguel is single. He is 22 years old. He completed upper secondary school and graduated from a program. He weaves clothing and sheets. He started this business with the support of his father, and he has 3 years of experience up to now.

He is asking for a loan that he will use to buy raw material in order to increase his production of textiles. He is going to buy raw material consisting of thread in different colors. In the future he hopes to have an established business with better earnings.

loans.use: to buy thread for textiles

loans.name: Dianey Trixi

texts.es: La Sra. Emma de 39 años de edad es divorciada y tiene 2 dependientes económicos. Ella sabe que tiene que salir adelante por sus dos hijos, siempre se ha esforzado por ofrecerles lo mejor es por eso que tiene dos trabajos uno es desempeñándose como secretaria en la oficina de correo en el turno de día y el otro es un negocio que tiene ubicado en su domicilio de esta manera ella se encarga de que sus hijos no tengan carencia alguna. En esta ocasión Emma está solicitando un crédito para remodelación de un cuarto en su casa. Agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en: Emma is 39 years old and is divorced with two dependent children. She knows that she needs to keep working hard for her two children, and she has always strived to provide them with the best. To do so she works two jobs: she works as a secretary at the post office during the day and she runs a business out of her home by night. This way she ensures that her children do not lack for anything. Emma is requesting a loan at this time in order to remodel a room in her home. She is grateful for any assistance you may be able to provide.

loans.use: to remodel a room in her house.

loans.name: Dukundubuhinzi №3 A / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modeste  est le membre et le président du groupe Dukundubuhinzi №3 A / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie «ceux qui aiment à cultiver».Il a 40 ans et il est marié avec 2 enfants de 3 ans  à 6 ans, dont 1 scolarisé. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Modeste est cultivateur de riz. C’est son Quatrième cycle de prêt avec ACB et il dit que le crédit antérieur a aidé ses activités de l’agriculture de riz beaucoup et il n’a pas attendue aucunes difficultés de non remboursement du crédit. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur producteur dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.

REMARQUE:Le crédit antérieur était la troisième cycle pas la premier cycle c'est une erreur à corriger.
texts.en:
Philippe is a member and the president of the group Dukundubuhinzi no. 3A/RSZ. The name of this group means "those who like farming". He is 40 years old and married with two children ages 3 and 6; one of them is at school. Philippe himself has six years of primary education.

Philippe is a rice farmer. This is his fourth loan cycle with ACB and he plans to use the credit to buy fertilizers and pay for labor. Philippe has stated that the previous loans have greatly helped his activity, and he has not experienced any difficulties with repayment. 

He plans to expand his business by obtaining additional loans to bolster his activities. In the coming years, Philippe hopes to become the leading rice farmer in the region. He plans to use his profits to provide for his children’s education and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

loans.name: Nyameke

texts.en: Nyameke  is married and has three children. She sells plantains at Jukwa near Abura. Nyameke has been selling food for the past eight years. She uses her income to help her husband pay their housing costs. Nyameke will use her loan to purchase more varieties of food stuffs to sell. With the new profit, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members. She sells new clothes in a shop that she rents. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She also earns additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. She has requested for a loan of Uganda shillings 1,500,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more clothes, jewelry, and shoes to sell. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children up to university level and start importing new clothes form China and Dubai. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes, jewelry and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 27 years old and a married mother of one child. She lives with her family in Msambweni, a town in the coastal region of Kenya which is well known for its nice beaches that attract many tourists.
Mariam makes her living in selling makuti (thatching materials made from palm frond). She has been in this business for the last eight years.Mariam buys makuti from various places. She also buys fronds and makes makuti to sell. She is requesting the loan to purchase more makuti to take advantage of this rainy season that requires most people to repair their leaking roofs.

loans.use: to purchase more makuti (thatching material).

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labor wages.

loans.name: Lucero

texts.es: La Sra. Lucero está solicitando el crédito para comprar mercancía, ella está casada el cual se dedica a dar mantenimiento de refrigeración en fabricas de la localidad. Comenta la Sra. Lucero que vivian un poco limitados en gastos por los estudios de sus hijos, y ella decidió emprender un pequeño negocio en él  la cual se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa nueva, perfumes, bolsas, accesorios etc. actualmente tiene 3 hijos pero solo uno es dependiente aun del  matrimonio.
texts.en: Lucero is requesting the loan to buy merchandise. She is married and her husband does cooling maintenance for the factories in the area. Lucero says that they were living a little limited in expenses for their children's studies, and she decided to start a small business in which she buys and sells new clothing, perfumes, bags, accesories, etc. She actually has three children, but only one of them is still dependent on the couple.

loans.use: to buy clothing and jewelry for her business.

loans.name: Vilman Elisabeth

texts.es:
La señora Vilman Elisabeth es casada, tiene 46 años de edad, estudio hasta el nivel diversificado, tiene 4 hijos 2 los cuales están estudiando, se dedica al comercio a la venta de ropa, inició este negocio siendo vendedor ambulante y hasta el momento lleva 6 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien dedica al mismo oficio. 

Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para compra de mercadería consistente en ropa: playeras, lencería, calzado para bebés, sudaderos. En el futuro espera ver su negocio más grande con la inversión que está haciendo.
texts.en:
Vilman Elisabeth is married, she is 46 years old, and has a high school education. She has four children, two of them in school. She works as a merchant, selling clothing. She started this business as a street vendor and has six years of experience so far. She gets help from her husband, who works in the same trade.

She has decided to request a loan and will use it to purchase merchandise: clothing items like t-shirts, lingerie, baby shoes, and sweatshirts.  By making this investment she hopes to see her business grow in the future.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, rice, and other products

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es:
La  Señora Marta tiene 27 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Tocoa, Departamento de Colon en compañía de su hijo y esposo.
Desde hace 5 años comenzó su negocio de venta de alimentos de la canasta básica a través de una pulpería o tienda de consumo. En su negocio vende arroz, manteca, azúcar café, papel higiénico, carnes, helados, medicamentos para enfermedades comunes, alimentos enlatados y golosinas.
Marta  ha solicitado un crédito por la cantidad de 12,000 Lempiras para surtir más su pulpería y hacer inversión en el mejoramiento de la apariencia de su negocio (mejoramiento de paredes y piso).
Considera que teniendo una buena administración de su negocio, logrará que su clientela siga creciendo al igual que sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Marta, 27, lives in the town of Tocoa, Colon Department with her son and husband.  She started selling basic staples five years ago in a grocery store.  She sells rice, lard, sugar coffee, toilet paper, meats, ice-cream, medicine for common illnesses, canned goods and sweets.  

Marta has requested a 12,000 Lempira loan to better stock her grocery store and to invest in improving its appearance (improve walls and floor).  She considers that if her store is managed well her clientele as well as her profits will continue growing.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise and to improve the store's appearance.

loans.name: Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Mercedes de la ciudad de Luque surgio por medio de una de las miembros, quien con ganas de ayudar a sus amigas y vecinas las motivo a que dia a dia se esfuerzen al maximo para salir adelante.
La sra.Julia , una de las miembros, se dedica a la costura, esta casada con el señor Victor. Ella solicito el credito para la compra de tela, hilos y todos los demas insumos necesarios para la costura, ella trabaja en su casa en conjunto con su mama, trabajan para una fabrica, pero en su domicilio, ella espera algun dia tener un negocio mas grande y mas personal para una mejor produccion.
texts.en:
The group Las Mercedes in the city of Luque was started by one of its members, who wanted to help her friends and neighbors, and motivated them to do their utmost best in order to get ahead.  

One of these members, Julia, works sewing. She is married to Victor. She has requested the loan to purchase fabric, thread, and other sewing supplies. She works at home along with her mother. They both work for a factory but she hopes to one day have a larger and more personal business so that production improves.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie lives at Kakata with her husband and three children. She is 36 years old. Mamie stopped her education in the 6th grade. Her children are between the ages of 7 and 18 and are currently in school. 

Mamie has been involved in her business for the past 10 years. She sells palm oil, pepper, rice, cooking oil, salt, onions and other items in the market. She started with a little income that she received from her husband. Now she is proud because with the profit that she generates from the business, she buys goods to improve the business and helps her husband with the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, rice, salt, onions and other items for the business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, salt, onions and other items for the business.

loans.name: Nixon Eder

texts.es:
Nixon es un hombre de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, tiene 2 hijos, a quienes ama y son principal razón en la vida, lamentablemente por diversas razones se separó de su pareja, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; gracias a su esfuerzo pudo estudiar la carrera técnica de mecánica automotriz, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño, entusiasmo y gracias al apoyo de su madre, Nixon puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de reparación y conversión de vehículos, en especial de gips, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana él asiste a su pequeño taller ubicado en un grifo de su ciudad, donde alquila un pequeño espacio para realizar sus labores, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que la bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Nixon se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de herramientas para su taller, tales como tuercas, llaves, gata, entre otros; de esta manera Nixon tendrá su negocio mejor acondicionado y podrá contar con las herramientas necesarias para realizar su labor, así él espera aumentar sus servicios e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda tener su taller propio.
texts.en:
Nixon is a 28-year-old man who lives in the city of Ica, in the district of Parcona. He has two children, whom he loves and who are the principal reason for his life. Unfortunately, for various reasons, he is separated from his partner.

Nixon is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who dedicates all his efforts to moving his family ahead. Thanks to his effort, he was able to study for a technical career as an automobile mechanic. In his spare time he enjoys playing soccer with his friends and, on some occasions, he cooks a very delicious “Ceviche” to share with his family. 

With a great deal of hard work, enthusiasm and thanks to his mother’s support, Nixon started his small business repairing and converting vehicles, especially GPS systems. Every day from early hours of the morning, he goes to his small workshop located at a service station in the city, where he rents a small space to do his work. He can work approximately 12 hours a day and believes that he is doing well because of his dedication and the friendly service he gives his customers.

Nixon is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help they have given him, he was able to purchase tools for his workshop, such as screws, wrenches and jacks, among others. Consequently, Nixon will have his business better equipped and will have the tools at hand that he needs to do his work. Thus, he plans to expand his services and increase his earnings, which will insure that in the not too distant future, he will be able to have his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his mechanic's workshop.

loans.name: Virgen De Itacua Group

texts.es:
Virgen de Itacuá es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está en el octavo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras y trabaja con la fundación desde el año 2010.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. María, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas y bebidas y es gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio que está saliendo adelante y es por ello que siempre se esfuerza para poder dejar atrás la pobreza.
Cuenta la Sra. María que el crédito que solicita de la fundación y kiva lo utilizará para la compra de insumos y bebidas para su negocio,  ella se encuentra  muy agradecida ya que gracias a el crédito podrá mejorar sus ingresos y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Virgen de Itacuá is from the city of Encarnación.  They're in the eighth cycle of the women entrepreneurs program and they've worked with the foundation since 2010.

One of the members of the group in María.  She makes a living selling food and beverages, and thanks to her work and sacrifice she's getting ahead.  This is why she always makes the effort to be able to leave poverty behind.

María says that she'll buy supplies and beverages for her business with the loan she's requesting from the foundation and Kiva.

She's very grateful because thanks to the loan she'll be able to improve her income and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy beverages and other supplies

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena cooks banku to sell at Jukwa near Abura. She serves her banku with fried fish and vegetable sauce. Abena is marrried and has 3 children. Her husband is a mason. She uses her income to assists the husband in the general upkeep of their home. Abena will use her loan to purchase maize for her banku, fish and vegetables for her sauce. With the new profit, Abena wishes to mount a stall for the sale of her banku.

loans.use: purchase maize for her banku, fish and vegetables for her sauce.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua sells saucepans at Jukwa near Abura. She has been into this business for 7 years now. She is married to a mason and has 2 children. Efua uses her income to assist the husband in paying their children’s school fees. She will need a loan to purchase saucepans and other cooking utensils for sale. With the new profit, Efua hope to build a shop where she will sell her cooking utensils.

loans.use: purchase saucepans and other cooking utensils for sale

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian runs a boutique business in Kapsabet town, and has been in operation for two years now, earning 15,000 KES monthly. The business really improved greatly, so she has applied for her third loan with KADET LTD for 80,000 KES and plans to use it to purchase new clothes for resale. With the anticipated profits, she will plough them back into business. Her hope and dream is that her business prospers so as to earn more profits and expand her boutique shop.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Glenda Ziomara

texts.es:
La  Señora Glenda tiene 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, reside en el municipio de Tela, Departamento de Atlántida.
Con el fin de obtener ingresos que le permitan sostener su familia, Doña Glenda inicio su negocio desde hace 10 años, dicho negocio consiste en la venta de ropa, cosméticos y joyería (aretes y cadenas).
 Para tener más opciones que ofrecer a sus clientes, ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 5,000 Lempiras para la compra de un fardo de ropa usada o de segunda mano.
Ella piensa que esta inversión le ayudara a obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan sacar adelante a sus hijos con la educación.
texts.en:
Glenda, 45, is a single mother.  She has two children and lives in the town of Tela, Atlántida Department.  Aiming at earning income to support her family, Glenda started her business ten years ago.  She sells clothes, cosmetics and jewelry (earrings and chains).

In order to have more options available for her customers, she’s requested a 5,000 Lempira loan to buy a bundle of second-hand or used clothes.  She believes that this investment will help her earn higher income so that she can provide her children with an education.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: La Novia Del Norte Horqueta Group

texts.es:
El comité cuenta con 10 integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad por mas pequeña que sea. Las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, por la oportunidad de progreso que les está dando la fundación y Kiva.
Hilaria es la presidenta, ella se dedica a la venta de insumos de primera necesidad, con lo cual ayuda a su familia y les da lo que necesitan para una vida digna y decorosa. El sueño de Hilaria es que su familia no tenga que pasar por ningún tipo de privaciones y es por eso que lucha.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, panificados, etc.
texts.en: The committee has ten members each with her own activity no matter how small.  They are very excited because of the opportunity they are being given by the Fundación and Kiva.  Hilaria is the president and she sells basic staples to help her family and give them what they need to live with dignity and decorum.  Hilaria’s dream is that her family not goes through any sort of privation which is why she strives so hard.  She’s asking for the loan to buy beverages, dairy products, baked goods, etc.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products and baked goods.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 33 years old. He is married to a farmer. He has been a maize farmer for 16 years. He will use his loan to support labor costs and fertilizer purchases during maize production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With the profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines like tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The photo, taken recently at another maize farming plantation, shows him very happy and excited that previous season was very helpful for both family needs and business. The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs in his maize production.

loans.name: Lord Own Group

texts.en:
The Lord Own group is made up of 3 women who sell items such as fish, soap, and shoes. 

Caroline is the leader of the group. She is 46 years old, single, and has a child.

Caroline sells shoes and soap to her customers and also delivers on demand. She started this business 7 years ago by using her own funds. Her main challenge is that she sometimes has to sell on credit.

With this new loan, she will be able to buy 2 boxes of shoes and 1 box of soap. She has been with ID Ghana for 3 years, and this is her fifth loan. She needs Kiva’s support of 1,200 Ghana Cedis. 

They need a total of 2,100 Ghana Cedis to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy 2 boxes of shoes and 1 box of soap

loans.name: Basilides

texts.es:
El señor Basilides tiene 47 años, está casado desde hace mucho tiempo con la señora Felipa y viven en su propia de la ciudad de Encarnación.
El señor Basilides es dueño de un Comedor en el centro mismo de la ciudad de Encarnación, tiene mucha clientela en la zona ya que su local se encuentra situado cerca de la terminal por lo tanto acuden turistas y clientes de los alrededores. La esposa es cocinera y se dedica a organizar el menú y preparar las variadas comidas. Gracias a este trabajo ellos han podido salir adelante, educar a sus hijos, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier imprevisto.
El señor Basilides ha solicitado este crédito para la ampliación de la cocina del local, ya que es muy necesario para seguir trabajando y de esa forma aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en: Basilides, 47, has been married to Felipa for a long time; they live in their own house in the city of Encarnación.  Basilides owns a snack bar in downtown Encarnación.  He has many customers in the area because his snack bar is located near a terminal so many tourists and customers from the area come by.  His wife’s the cook and organizes the menu and prepares a variety of dishes.  Thanks to this work they have been able to get ahead, educate their children, maintain their home and overcome unexpected expenses.  Basilides has asked for this loan to enlarge the snack bar’s kitchen because it’s necessary in order to continue working and to increase income.

loans.use: to enlarge the kitchen.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos es de profesion albañil y cuenta que hace mas de 20 años que se dedica a su profesion. Comenta que está casado y que su señora lo ayuda cuidando la casa y con otros trabajos que ella hace.
El es una persona muy trabajadora y comenta además que siempre tiene mucho trabajo ya que tiene una vasta experiencia en lo que está haciendo.  Solicitó el credito para arreglo de su vivienda, ya que quiere poder dar un techo digno a su familia, y sabe que este crédito le ayudará mucho.
texts.en: Carlos works in construction and has been working in his profession for more than 20 years.  He comments that he’s married and his wife helps him by caring for the house and with other work she does.  He’s a very hardworking person and he says that he always has much work because he has vast experience in his line of work.  He requested the loan to do some home repairs because he wants to provide a proper home for his family and he knows that this loan will help him very much to do so.

loans.use: to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame sells mazie and gari at Jukwa near Abura. Maame has been selling gari and maize for 15 years now. She lives together with her husband and her 7 dependents. Her husband operates a grocery shop. Maame uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Maame will use her loan to purchase bags of gari and maize for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of gari and maize for sale.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El Sr. Armando es de la ciudad de Pilar, tiene un taller de tornería y se dedica a esta actividad hace más de 20 años, está casado tiene 2 hijos, quienes son su razón de lucha.
Es una persona muy trabajadora, con buenas referencias  tiene varias operaciones ya con la fundación,  además de eso nos cuenta que gracias a su arduo trabajo da a su familia todo lo que puede para que no pasen por necesidades.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio en la compra de materiales, como ser varillas de hierro, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con sus pedidos.
texts.en: Armando’s from the city of Pilar.  He has a lathe metal shop, an activity he’s been in for 20 years.  He’s married and has two children who are the reason he strives for.  He’s a very hardworking person with good references.  He’s has several transactions with the Fundación already and he also relates that thanks to his hard work he gives his family everything he can so that they will lack nothing.  He’s asking for the loan to invest in his business with the purchase of materials like iron rods to continue working and filling orders.

loans.use: to buy iron rods.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.en:
Pelagie is 42 years old. She is married to a farmer and they have five children who are enrolled in school. She has been a maize farmer for 20 years. She will use her Kiva loan to support labor costs of maize production and buy fertilizer in order to increase production. With her profits from farming, Pelagie wishes to invest in her business so that in the future, she can acquire machines such as tractors to enhance her farming capacity. This photo was taken recently at a maize farming plantation. Pelagie was very happy and excited that the previous season was very helpful for both her family's needs and her business. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer and support labor costs of maize production.

loans.name: Florence Group

texts.en:
This is Florence group. The group is made up of Florence and Gladys, who work in cosmetics and hairdressing. They are 54 and 32 years old, respectively.

Florence is a 54-year-old cosmetics seller. She has been doing this job for 25 years and is in her 4th loan cycle with ID Ghana. She was given 400 Ghana cedis in her 3rd loan cycle, which she used to buy more hair and body pomades, shea butter, and fragrance. Florence sells to customers in Nungua, a suburb of Accra. She saves part of her profit with ID Ghana and reinvests a portion. She is married and has 3 children.

Florence and Gladys together need 1,050 Ghana cedis to improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more hair and body pomades, shea butter, and fragrance.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is a person who enjoys her work and is very responsible in her activities. She lives with her six children, only one of whom is still in school. She is a widow but does not give up on life. 

Sophia earns a living by selling charcoal. She has been in this business for five years and this is the first loan she is requesting from Yehu. She will use her loan to buy sacks of charcoal to stock her store. This investment will allow Sophia to increase her sales, which will help her improve her children's quality of life. Sophia's dream is to expand her market so that she can distribute her charcoal to other places.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to stock her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a hairdresser. She operates a beauty salon, which she has done for 11 years now. Mary is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver and they live together at Jukwa near Abura. She uses her income to support the husband to feed and clothe their children. Mary will use her loan to purchase hair extentions, wigs, hair creams and a hair dryer for her salon. With the new profit, Mary will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase hair extentions, wigs, hair creams and a hair dryer for her salon.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria desde pequeña quizo tener un negocio propio para lo cual consulto con sus familiares(padres)una base fuera de la casa para una bazar-fotocopiadora. 

En la actualidad tiene su bazar-fotocopiadora, su horario de trabajo empieza 7:30am hasta las 22:00pm y su hermana le ayuda en el negocio, unas de sus dificultades es que su salud decaiga y no pueda atender su negocio. 
Con el prestamo quiere comprar papeleria y cuadernos, tambien ayudar en un restaurante con el prestamo va a comprar papelerias, snack y colas
texts.en:
Maria, from the time she was small, wanted to own a business. Thus she consulted with her relatives (parents) about acquiring a space outside of the house to have a photocopy and stationary shop.

Currently she has a stationary and photocopy shop. Her work schedule begins at 7:30 a.m. until 10 p.m. and her sister helps her in the business. One of her difficulties is that her health has declined and she can no longer take care of her business. 

With the loan she wants to purchase stationary and notebooks and also help in a restaurant. With the loan, she is going to buy stationary, snacks and colas.

loans.use: to purchase stationary, notebooks.

loans.name: 14 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
14 de Agosto se denomina el buen grupo de mujeres conformado en la ciudad de Itá, gracias a que la actual presidenta la Sra. Zoila, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona, para informarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, una vez asesorada acerca del Programa logró juntar a 21 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando en el 3 ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La Sra. Zoila siempre trata de motivar a sus compañeras a seguir luchando por sus metas y así ser cada día mejores. Ella se dedica a la costura y nos dice que siempre está muy atareada con los trabajos que recibe, ya que tiene mucho y es por ello que solicita el crédito, ya que desea comprar telas e hilos, como también botones y cierres para poder cumplir con los pedidos que tiene. Agradece por la ayuda que ella y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
14 de Agosto is the name of a good group of women which was founded in the city of Itá thanks to Zolia, the current President, who contacted the advisor at a weekly meeting she had in the area, to find out how the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Enterprising Women Committee) worked. When she learned about the program, she managed to bring 21 women together. They support each other and are now working collectively on their third cycle within the program.

Zoila always tries to motivate her fellow members to keep fighting for their goals and better themselves. She is a seamstress and tells us that the jobs she receives always keep her very busy, because she gets a lot of them. That is why she is requesting a loan, because she wants to purchase fabric and thread as well as buttons and zippers so that she can fill all of the orders she has. She is thankful for the help she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, and buttons.

loans.name: Umar

texts.en: Umar is a married man with 5 children in addition to a dependent who is his nephew. All the children attend school. Umar charges car, as well as phone, batteries and sells food stuffs, like groceries, to meet his family's needs. He wants 600,000 UGX to pay school fees for his son who is completing high school. His main challenge is high cost of electricity which eats into his income, reducing his profit. Umar works so hard to see all his children through school.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Fortune

texts.en:
Fortune is an 18-year-old full-time student at African Leadership Academy (ALA), a two year pre-university program in Johannesburg, South Africa, with a mission to identify, develop, and connect Africa’s future leaders. 

Fortune was selected as one of 95 ALA students out of a pool of over 3,000 applicants from across the continent for his passion for public service, his commitment to Africa, and his demonstrated leadership potential to lead change in Africa and beyond. 

Fortune is applying for a loan of $500, which will enable him to purchase a laptop to conduct assignments and research, to run his community service project and/or student run business which forms part of the ALA curriculum, and to participate fully in the world-class program offered by ALA.

Fortune comes from Mutare, Zimbabwe and is one of a family of eight. Growing up in Zimbabwe, Fortune was surrounded by high levels of unemployment. He recognised early on that unemployment was a major challenge to the economic and social development of his country. It is Fortune’s long-term goal to bring about change to address this pressing social issue.

Fortune identified and addressed a need in his community when he noticed the unpleasant surroundings of the local hospital near his boarding school. Fortune felt the need to improve the area as it had become a breeding ground for mosquitos and snakes. He appealed to his fellow classmates to help the hospital personnel tidy up the surroundings of the hospital. He managed to mobilize a group of students to pick up papers and cut the long grass around the hospital – efforts that were recognized by the nurse in charge of the hospital.   This is now an on-going project.

A natural leader, Fortune has held multiple leadership positions.
