loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: Ignacio de 60 años de edad, es un señor  que a pesar de su edad trabaja muy duro como lo ha hecho siempre para tener una vida estable.  El vive junto a su familia en una pequeña parcela en  la cual puede sembrar frijoles, maíz y maicillo, granos básicos los cuales comercializa en diferentes mercados del municipio en el que reside. Ignacio solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de maíz, frijoles y maicillo para sembrar, de esta forma él espera incrementar su cosecha y así aumentar al máximo sus ventas.
texts.en: Ignacio is 60 years old, and he is a man who despite his age works very hard as he has always done in order to have a stable life.  He lives together with his family on a small parcel of land in which he plants beans, corn and sorghum, basic grains that he sells in different markets of the city in which he resides.  Ignacio is asking for a loan from Kiva partner INTEGRAL, through which he will be able to count on the necessary funds to invest in the purchase of corn, beans and sorghum for planting.  In this way he hopes to increase his crop and thus maximize his sales.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for planting

loans.name: Sedekon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEDEKON est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Yvette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Yvette est âgée de 28 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Eric. Le couple a deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Yvette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Yvette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Yvette assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Pour assurer ses différentes charges, Yvette mène comme activité la vente des tissus à son domicile. Yvette exerce cette activité depuis huit ans. Yvette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Yvette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEDEKON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur servira à rehausser le stock de ses produits et à augmenter leur clientèle. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Sedekon group is composed of three friends living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, by the name of Yvette, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Yvette is 28 years old and is married to Eric, a stonemason. They have two children, one of whom is in school and both of whom are in the couple’s care. Yvette  never attended school. Yvette lives together with her husband and children. Together with her husband, Yvette provides for various family needs. In order to support herself, Yvette sells fabric out of her home. She has been in this business for eight years. Yvette stocks up at a market in Benin markets. With the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales volume and he revenues, Yvette, together with the other members of the Sedekon group, is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow the group members to enlarge their stock of goods and attract more customers. The prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa sells charcoal at Wiomoa near Abura. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a carpenter. Adjoa has been selling charcoal for 8 years. She is responsible for helping her husband in paying their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy bags of charcoal to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Rixon Paolo

texts.es:
Rixon tiene 25 años es casado y tiene un hijo de 4 años que esta en escuela. En el sector donde vive Rixon existe el tipo transporte tricimoto, las personas se trasladan a sus alrededores en tales vehiculos,o hasta donde la ley de transito les permita llegar ya que es un medio de transporte rápido. 
Hace algunos años Rixon tubo  la oportunidad de comprarse una tricimoto, ahora le va muy bien ya que con este ingreso   mantiene su hogar. 
Su esposa  se dedica a las tareas del hogar y a cuidar a su niño. Su trabajo lo realiza solo desde la 6 am hasta las 10pm. Con el prestamo quiere comprar herramientas y llanatas para su tricimoto. Rixon se esfuerza todos los días pues tiene metas que cumplir unas de ellas es comprarse otra tricimoto y construir su casa de cemento.
texts.en:
Rixon is 25 years old and married and has a 4 year old son who goes to school.  In the area when Rixon lives, there is a type of transportation called the "tricimoto."  People move around the city on these vehicles, or go wherever the laws permit them to travel, since it's a rapid means of transport.

A few years ago, Rixon had the opportunity to buy a  tricimoto, and now it's going very well for him as a source of income.  He maintains his household this way.

His wife is a housewife and takes care of their child.  His work is done from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  With the loan, he wants to buy spare parts and tires for his tricimoto.  Rixon works hard every day because he has goals to meet, and one of these is to buy another tricimoto and to build a cement block house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tires.

loans.name: Sonia  Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia  Elizabeth de 40años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y cuatro hijos menores de edad. Ella se dedica junto a su esposo a la siembra de maíz, frijoles y loroco, los cuales comercializan en mercados de la zona. Así mismo ella posee un taller de costurería  en donde elabora uniformes para niños y empleados. Sonia solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para poder comprar telas, hilos, botones y todos los insumos necesarios para elaborar más uniformes. Así también desea comprar abono para el cuidado de sus cultivos. Sonia es muy responsable y dedicada a todo lo que hace para salir adelante.
texts.en: Sonia  Elizabeth is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and four minor children. She and her husband grow corn, beans and loroco, which they sell in the area markets. She also has a sewing workshop where she makes uniforms for schoolchildren and workers. Sonia is asking for a loan from  INTEGRAL to be able to buy fabric, thread, buttons and all necessary materials to make uniforms. She also wants to buy fertilizer to care for her crops. Sonia is very responsible and dedciated to everything she does in order to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy corn seed to plant.

loans.name: Santos Ceferino

texts.es: Santos Ceferino es una persona muy conocida en su lugar de residencia por ser muy responsable y trabajador, el se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles en su propio terreno. Santos   posteriormente comercializa los granos en mercados y tiendas. Con el anhelo de hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar la cantidad de clientes y así mismo sus ventas, Santos  solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, esto con el enorme deseo de comprar mayor cantidad de semillas para sembrar, así mismo para adquirir algunos compartimientos para conservar los granos frescos, y también para comprar pesticidas. Santos  desea realizar lo mejor posible su trabajo, ya que de esta forma podrá contar con más clientes fijos y satisfechos que compren sus productos lo que es muy positivo para el crecimiento de su negocio y la economía de su hogar.
texts.en: Santos Ceferino is very well-known in his town for being responsible and hard-working.  He works planting corn and beans on his own land.  Santos then sells his grains in markets and stores.  With the hope of growing his business and increasing the number of clients and thus sales, Santos is asking for a loan from Kiva partner INTEGRAL.  He does this with an enormous desire to purchase a greater quantity of seeds for planting, as well as to acquire some storage containers to conserve the fresh grain, and also to buy pesticides.  Santos wants to do the best he can at his job, since in that way he will be able to count on more customers who are stable and satisfied and who will buy his products.  This would be very positive for growing his business and improving the economic situation at home.

loans.use: To buy seeds to plant.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells vegetables and meat pies at Wiomoa near Abura. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a driver. Esi has been selling vegetables and meat pies for 7 years. She supports her husband in paying their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy vegetables to sell and flour to prepare her meat pies. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell and flour to prepare her meat pies

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells Fanti Kenkey (a type of dumplings with sauce) at Wiomoa near Abura. Aba is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a farmer. Aba has been selling Fanti Kenkey for 1 year. She supports her husband in paying their utility and accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize to produce her Kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business .

loans.use: to buy maize to produce her Kenkey for sale

loans.name: Deybys Alex

texts.es:
Deybys es un joven de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación, gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres Deybys se encuentra estudiando la carrera técnica de Computación e Informática, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Escabeche de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Deybys trabaja como obrero en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana él asiste a su centro de trabajo para iniciar su labor, él puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Deybys se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para realizar sus trabajos prácticos y para sus estudios; de esta manera Deybys contará con la herramienta adecuada para cursar satisfactoriamente sus estudios, para así poder convertirse en un buen profesional, así Deybys seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que junto con su familia pueda salir adelante.
texts.en:
Deybys is a young 20 year-old man who lives in the city of Ica with his parents and brothers.  He is a very friendly, hard-working, enthusiastic person with a great desire to get ahead.  Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents Deybys finds himself studying towards an advanced degree in Computer Science.  In his free time he likes to play sports and sometimes cook a delicious marinated chicken dish to share with his family (Escabeche de pollo).  With much effort and enthusiasm, Deybys works as a laborer at an agricultural estate in his city.  Every day from very early in the morning he arrives at the work site to begin his labor.  He can work around 8 hours a day and he thinks it is going well because of his dedication and his kind treatment of others.  

Deybys is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they provide he will be able to purchase a computer, which will help him greatly to complete the practical applications for his studies.  In this way Deybys will be able to count on an adequate tool in order to pursue his studies satisfactorily.  He hopes to become a good professional, and thus he will continue to work and challenge himself so that together with his family he can get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Ababa

texts.en: Ababa is married and has 4 children. Ababa sells Fanti Kenkey (a type of dumplings with sauce) at Wiomoa near Abura, which she has done for 5 years. Her husband is a carpenter. Ababa uses her income to provide for her children. Ababa will use the loan to purchase bags of maize to prepare her Kenkey for sale. With the new profits, Ababa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to prepare her Kenkey for sale

loans.name: Méthodiste Plus Group

texts.en:
Tshabidi is 52 years old and married.   She has nine children between 9 and 34 years old.  Five of them go to school.

Tshabidi is a leader of the community bank named “Méthodiste Plus,” which is composed of 17 microentrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Tshabidi runs a restaurant.  She has a solid experience in that field. With her first loan from Hope, she has been in the business world since 1990. Her business makes about $50 per week in profit. 

She has been a faithful Hope’s client, having twice obtained and correctly repaid loans. Since then her business has prospered. 

She plans with the coming loan to increase the stock of her restaurant by purchasing fish and chickens that her clients need. She is working very hard and would like to continue receiving Hope loans to achieve her dreams of someday opening a supermarket in her environment.

loans.use: to increase her restaurant's inventory by purchasing fish and chickens.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua  is a widow and has two children.  Efua sells grocery items at Wiomoa near Abura, which she has done since 15 years. Efua uses her income to  provide for her children. 

Efua will use the loan to buy grocery items like tinned fish, tinned tomatoes, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees,  milk, and soap to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of grocery items for her store.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama sells charcoal at Wiomoa near Abura. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Ama has been selling charcoal for five years. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the accommodation and utility bills. 

Her loan will be used to buy bags of charcoal to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: buy bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: La Paix 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA PAIX 1 est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, Afiavi Célestine, celle dont la main est levée sur la photo est âgée de 53 ans. Afiavi Célestine est une veuve et mère de cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Afiavi Célestine vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule ses diverses charges. Afiavi Célestine n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Afiavi Célestine vend des conserves et des condiments à son domicile. Il y a environs huit ans que Afiavi Célestine exerce cette activité. Afiavi Célestine s’approvisionne dans des régions du Bénin. En vue de rehausser le niveau de son activité, Afiavi Célestine ambitionne agrandir son stock de vente; ce qui lui permettra de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Afiavi Célestine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LA PAIX 1, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The La Paix [Peace] 1 group consists of three individuals living in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Afiavi Celestine, is the one raising her hand in the photo, is 53 years old. Afiavi Celestine is a widow and the mother of five children, all in school and in her care. Afiavi Celestine leaves alone with her children and provides for family needs on her own. Afiavi Celestine never attended school. She sells canned food and condiments out of her home. She has been in this business for about eight years. She stocks up in various regions of Benin. In order to expand her business, Afiavi Celestine would like to expand her stock of goods, which will allow her to better meet customers’ expectations. In order to do so, Afiavi Celestine, together with the other members of the La Paix 1 group, is seeking her fourth loan from ALIDé. The prior loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy canned food and condiments.

loans.name: Bco. Mujer Buscando Superarse Group

texts.es:
Grupo de mujeres de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, esta es una zona que se caracteriza por grandes plantaciones de Palma Aceitera, por esta razón la oferta de empleo para mujeres es poca, ya que esta actividad demanda mucha mano de obra masculina, por esta razón estas mujeres se ven en la necesidad de autoemplearse, mediante el desarrollo de una actividad productiva acorde a las condiciones de su entorno.
Evelin presidenta y lider del grupo, es una mujer de 34 años con dos hijos, uno de 10 y otro de 15 años, que en este momento subsiste con la actividad de la cria de cerdos para engorde, ya que su esposo sufrio un accidente laboral, por lo cual recibe un subsidio, el cual no es suficiente para poder hacerle frente a las necesidades del hogar, esta situación que el compañero este en la situación antes mencionada, hace necesario que Evelin busque tambien oportunidades de empleo por horas, limpiando casas, para poder generar mas ingresos que se traducen en tratar de brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
El préstamo como los anteriores que ha recibido de Fundación Mujer, se destinara a la compra de cerdos como concentrados y vacunas.
Dentro de sus planes esta el poder seguir trabajando duro para poder darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
A group of women from the southern region of Costa Rica; this is a zone known for its large-scale palm oil plantations.  FOr this reason, there are few offerings of work for women, since this type of work entails a high demand for male day laborers.  Therefore, these women have seen the necessity of self-employment via the development of a productive business activity in alignment with their environmental conditions.

Evelin, the president and leader of the group, is a 34 year old woman with two children, one of whom is 10 and the other of 15 years of age.  At this time she subsists on growing pigs for fattening, since her husband had an accident in his work and from this he receives a stipend, which is not sufficient to cover the costs of the household.  This situation that has been mentioned, made it necessary for Evelin to also look for job opportunities for hourly wages, and cleaning houses, to create a greater income which will translate to a better quality of life for her family.

The loan, as with the previous ones she has received from Fundación Mujer, will go to buying pigs with feed concentrates and vaccines.  Within her plans is the hope of being able to continue working and to give her children a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy pigs, concentrates, and vaccines.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married and has two children.  Aba sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together) at  Wiomoa near Abura, which she has done for four years. Aba uses her income to provide for her children. 

Aba will use the loan to purchase bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients to prepare her waakye for sale. With the new profits, Aba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients to prepare her waakye for sale.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba sells children and ladies clothes at Wiomoa near Abura.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband is an electronics worker.

Araba has been selling children and ladies clothes for three years. She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to buy children and ladies wear. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy children and ladies wear to sell.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Umaru.  He is married, and he has three children, aged 3, 8, and 11 years. 

In 2000, Umaru established his cooking utensils and plastic products business. The business started to care for the needs of the family, after dropping out of school. 

He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000.  Umaru has already received and successfully repaid three loans.  He now requires a new loan to buy additional cooking utensils and plastic products. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 557,500. 

In the future, Umaru plans to be able to move from a stall to a shop. He thinks the loan can increase his stock and maximize his profit. When it rains, his business is disturbed. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for cooking utensils and plastic products.

loans.name: Veronica Albertina

texts.es:
Verónica tiene 35 años es de “Puerto Limón” pequeño pueblo de clima húmedo que se encuentra en Santo Domingo – Ecuador, ella es soltera y tiene un hijo de cuatro años que está en la escuela. Verónica comercializa productos cosméticos y además tiene una tienda de abarrotes, actividades que realiza para aprovechar el paso de turistas por la zona, ya que la ciudad se ha convertido en un gran eje comercial por ser una conexión entre las Regiones Costa y Sierra del país.
Verónica trabaja desde que sale el sol hasta que se oculta todos los días en su pequeña tienda pero sus ingresos económicos no son los suficientes por esta razón ella solicitó  a Fundación Alternativa un crédito para poder emprender con un nuevo negocio que atenderá paralelamente con sus actividades de comercialización, su idea es comprar chanchos y criarlos para venderlos e incrementar sus ganancias. Verónica es una mujer trabajadora y piensa que con el trabajo fuerte que ejerce será una base para su crecimiento y así poco a poco alcanzar uno de sus sueños de comprar una pequeña casa en la que su hijo pueda crecer y formarse de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
Veronica, who is 35 years old, is from Puerto Limón, a little city with a humid climate located in Santo Domingo, Ecuador.  She is single and has a four-year-old son who is in school. Veronica sells cosmetic products and also has a grocery store, businesses that she runs to take advantage of the passage of tourists through this area, since the city has become a big commercial axis because it connects the coastal and mountain regions of the country.

Veronica works from sun-up until dark every day in her little store, but her income is not sufficient. For this reason, she applied to Fundación Alternativa for a loan to be able to begin a new business that she will run in parallel with her sales activities. Her idea is to buy pigs and raise them to sell and to increase her earnings. Veronica is a hard-working woman, and she thinks that with the hard work that she exerts it will be a basis for her growth and thus little by little she will achieve one of her dreams of buying a little house in which her son can grow and develop in the best way.

loans.use: to begin a new business, raising pigs to sell

loans.name: Dorah

texts.en:
Dorah is a person who very much wants to get ahead.  She tries to get ahead to have a better life. That is why she approached Yehu to request a new loan to expand her business. 

She’s asking for a loan to buy products such as rice, wheat flour, and cooking oil to be used in her food preparation to better satisfy customers.

Dorah narrates that her previous loan helped to improve her business. Her goal is to open new businesses.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
This is 48-year-old Abass.  He is married, and he has four children, aged 3, 6, 13, and 18 years. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to assist in the business.  

In 1986, Abass established his shoes, jeans, shorts, T-shirts, and shirts business. The business started by selling used clothing but now sells ready-made items and is self reliant.

He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000.   Abass has already received and successfully repaid three loans.  He now requires a new loan to buy additional shoes, jeans, shorts, T-shirts, and shirts. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by about Le 660,000. 

In the future, Abass plans to purchase school shoes and expand the business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for shoes, jeans, shorts, T-shirts, and shirts.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 28 years old and a single gentleman. He lives in the coast province of Kenya. He lives with his parents in a family house and helps them in the household expenses

Teddy sells phone accessories for a living in a rented store.  He is going to invest the money in the purchase of more accessories and electric appliances.

The loan will help him to increase sales and to have more quality products. Teddy’s dream is to have a bigger business. He has faced challenges such as high prices and competition.

loans.use: To purchase of more accessories and electric appliances.

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es: Juan Gabriel de veintitrés años de edad vive junto a sus padres José y Claribel, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado valiosa experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo esta ubicado en una zona apta para la siembra y cercano a la localidad donde reside, comercia en todos los alrededores de la comunidad es muy conocido y se ha hecho de mucha clientela que lo prefiere por los buenos precios,  la calidad del producto y el excelente servicio; Juan es un hombre enérgico, dedicado a su labor, amable y muy honesto, siempre esta en toda la disposición de salir adelante y buscar un futuro mejor, en la temporada pasada aumentaron las ganancias y en esta siembra quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, insecticida, abono, herbicida, etc. Juan Gabriel tiene buenas referencias de pago y es responsable asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene fe que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Juan Gabriel is 23 years old. He lives with his parents, José and Claribel. His work is growing corn. He has a number of years of experience working in agriculture, and this has given him valuable experience that allows him to obtain the best harvests. His land is located in an area suitable for planting and near the place where he lives. He sells in all the surrounding areas of the community. He is well known, and he has established many customers who prefer him for his good prices, the quality of his products, and his excellent service. Juan is an energetic man, dedicated to his work, friendly and very honest. He is always ready to advance and seek a better future. In the past season he increased his earnings, and in this planting he wants to take advantage of this to make a new investment. For this reason, he is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy seeds for corn, insecticides, compost, herbicides, etc. Juan Gabriel has good payment references and is responsible. He assures that he will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time he has faith that he will bring economic security to his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds for corn, insecticides, compost, and herbicides

loans.name: Angel

texts.en: Angel will use his biodigester to process his animals' waste, which will reduce the odors that are currently plaguing his farm. Since he lives in an urban zone, this difference will be a huge improvement for both him and his neighbors. The waste from his cows and pigs will also allow him to decrease his natural gas use and favor the renewable biogas generated by his 8 cubic meter biodigester. The treated waste will provide him with a potent organic fertilizer, which he will use instead of the agrochemical fertilizer he currently pays thousands of pesos a year for. This Kiva loan will be used to fund 80% of the system's price.

loans.use: To purchase an 8 cubic meter biodigester

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn seeds, beans, herbicide, and insecticide

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.en: José Luis and his three brothers will use their Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to reduce the costs of their dairy farm. From Hidalgo, the four inherited the farm from their father and want to maintain the tradition, while also investing to lower costs and improve yields. With a 6 cubic meter biodigester, the cow manure will be processed, producing renewable energy in the form of biogas and organic fertilizer, which will then be applied to the crops used to feed the animals. By replacing agrochemical fertilizer and non-renewable LP gas use on their farm, the brothers will reduce their costs and their environmental footprint while maintaining their family legacy. This Kiva loan will be used to fund 84% of the system's price.

loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: El Eden 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is one of the members of her group, El Eden 2. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Hato Mayor, an area where the economy is centered around agriculture, because there is running water. She makes her home in a simple structure with her four children, and she is a widow.

Maria is excited to be taking out her tenth loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, after successfully repaying her previous loan and growing her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her grocery stall by purchasing different snacks, candies, and other goods. She sells them from her house and in a school located in her community. She will use the profits to re-invest in her business and to provide for her family's needs. She said that her most difficult challenge is to help her children become professionals. She will do this by enrolling them in school; therefore, giving them a safe future.

She started her business after she took out her first loan with Esperanza. She needed to earn money for her family and at the same time take care of her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба очень трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 26 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж работает в Российской Федерации и его зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Насиба занимается скотоводством, но ее доход не хватает для прживания. С целью организовать новый бизнес, она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одеждой, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 600 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nasiba is a very hard-working woman. She is 26 and married with two children. Her husband works in Russia, but his income does not let him provide for his family.
Nasiba raises animals, but her income is not sufficient to cover all expenses. In order to start a new business, she took an "Achieve Success" course offered by the Association of Women in Business and received a certificate. Nasiba wants to start a business sewing women's clothes as she is experienced in that business.
She plans to spend the profits on providing her children with good education and nutritious meals. She has requested a loan of 600 Somoni to buy a sewing machine to start her business. Nasiba appreciates your kindness.

loans.use: to buy sewing machine for her new business

loans.name: Jyostna

texts.en:
Surveys say poverty in rural India results in continuous illness of people. 40% of their income is spent on treatment of their health issues every year. In India, including Odisha, it is found that diseases like diarrhea, cholera, worm infection, constipation and piles are outcomes of outside defecation (ODF). The data say only 7% of rural areas are covered by toilet facilities in Odisha and it is only 22% throughout India. 

Kutragada is a small rural village in the Rayagada District of Odisha, India. Jyotsna, age about 34, is a permanent resident of this village. Her family is a very poor family in the "Below Poverty Line" category. She lives with her five-member family, composed of her husband; a son, age 6; father-in-law and mother-in-law. Jyotsna runs a small business stitching and selling leaf plates with the support of Mahashakti. Her husband runs a cycle repair center in front of the house. From the above two businesses, her family earns a monthly income of 6,000 Indian rupees (INR) per month. Due to low income, in spite of her concerns, Jyotsna was unable to construct a toilet for her family. So, by investing the present loan of 20,000 INR, Jyotsna is planning to construct a toilet for her house to get rid of outside defecation which results in health hazards. She wants to provide a safe and secure life as regards sanitation.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a toilet

loans.name: El Eden 1 Group

texts.en:
Casimira is the coordinator of her group El Eden (Eden) 1. This group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural town surrounded by mountains and nature. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. She is a stylist.

Casimira is excited to be taking her 13th loan with Kiva partner Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her Beauty Salon by purchasing a large quantity of beauty products and to get some equipment like a hair dryer and other items. She will re-invest the profits in her business.

She started doing her business after she worked in a beauty salon and then decided to have her own business. For her future, she is dreaming of improving her business and selling different products. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy hair and beauty products and some equipment

loans.name: Gitanjali

texts.en: Gitanjali belongs to a small village called Paikpada in the M Rampur block of the Kalahandi district of Odisha. Kalahandi is a very poor district in India, known for poverty, lack of education and lack of awareness. Gitanjali is 36 years old and hails form a poor background in the Below Poverty Line category. She lives with her husband, her son and her daughter. She is running a small fancy store in her house to earn revenue for her family. What she earns from her business is hand to mouth for them. She had a dream of constructing a toilet and bathroom for the safety and security of her family members as 80% of the health hazards come from bad sanitation but due to the scarcity of finances, she was unable to materialize her dream. Gitanjali says that it will be a blessing for her to take a loan of Rs 20,000/- to construct a bathroom with toilet to provide a sanitary facility for her family.

loans.use: To pay to construct a toilet

loans.name: Ayudanos Señor 1 Group

texts.en:
Lucienne is one of the members of the Ayúdanos Señor (Help Us Lord) Group 1. The majority of the group's members are emigrants from Haiti who live in "bateyes" (company towns where sugar workers live) in the town of Romana, one of the Dominican Republic's tourist destinations, which have a high scale of luxury. 

Lucienne's business is selling food, which she cooks to distribute to workers and to sell from her home to her neighbors. She has two children. She tells us that her biggest challenge is sending her children to university and that she enjoys going to church.

Lucienne is very excited to be receiving her eighth loan from Esperanza Internacional.  She will invest it in her business, which she has had for more than 12 years. She is planning to invest her loan in buying different cooking ingredients, such as rice, oil, beans, meat, vegetables, and disposable plates. 

She is dreaming of expanding her established business into a small restaurant in her community.  She is saving her profits to do this, and she thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, beans, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Ayudanos Señor 5 Group

texts.en:
Doris is the coordinator of the Ayúdanos Señor (Help Us Lord) Group 5. This group is composed of emigrants from Haiti who live in "bateyes" (company towns where sugar workers live) in the town of Romana, one of the Dominican Republic's tourist destinations, which have a high scale of luxury.

Doris is a cook.  She sells food that she cooks to distribute to workers in closer bateyes, for sugar cane or construction workers. 

She has two children.  She lives in a simple home with her long-term partner and their children, in a house they got from the sugar cane industry that owns the batey where they live. 

Doris is very excited to be receiving her seventh loan from Esperanza Internacional.  She will invest it in her business, which she has had for about eight years. 

She is planning to invest her loan in buying different cooking ingredients, such as rice, oil, beans, meat, and vegetables. She is dreaming of improving her business and getting more clients in other bateyes.

loans.use: To buy goods like rice, oil, beans, and meat.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline's school continued to experience growth after the first investment she made. Over the course of time, there has been a strain on the available resources. She has therefore applied for a loan of 62,650 Kenya shillings to purchase additional desks and books for the school. Her ambition is to graduate the enterprise to a primary school and provide additional facilities like computer lessons.

loans.use: To purchase desks, textbooks, and stationery.

loans.name: Mahugnon Group

texts.fr: MAHUGNON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans la même agglomération. La représentante du groupe, Sophie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 56 ans et est mariée à un certain Julien. Le couple a deux enfants, à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Sophie vit seule avec ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges des enfants. Sophie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Il y a près de dix ans que Sophie mène comme activité la vente des conserves et des sachets à son domicile. Sophie exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Sophie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Sophie sollicite un troisième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MAHUGNON is a group made up of three members who live in the same urban area.

The group's representative, Sophie, is the one raising her hand in the photo. She is 56 years old, married to a man named Julien, and the mother of two children, who both attend school and are still in their care. Sophie lives alone with her children, but she and her husband jointly take care of the various needs of the family. Sophie left school at the primary level. 

Sophie has been selling canned food as well as food in sachets for almost ten years now. She is passionate about her work, which allows her to meet her needs and those of her children. She buys her goods at a market located in Benin.

To ensure the satisfaction of her customers, Sophie is requesting a third loan, along with the other members of the MAHUGNON group. This loan will help them to better meet their customers' demand and to increase their profits.

Previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy canned food and food in sachets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional fish .to sell

loans.name: Janeclaudia

texts.en:
Janeclaudia lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has one child. 

She owns a clothes business that she has been operating for six years. She also owns a salon.  She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group.  She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are high fuel and transport costs, price fluctuations and inflation, and taxes. 

Janeclaudia is applying for a loan of KES 15,850 to purchase additional stocks of second-hand clothes. 

Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to increase her savings. Her dream is to open a larger boutique.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Newton

texts.en:
Newton is a resident of Kilifi area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. 

He operates a clothes business that has been in operation for three years. He learned about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of his business. His main challenges are seasonal weather and competition from other businesses of the same nature.

Newton is applying for a loan of KES 41,900 to buy clothes for his business. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to increase his income and improve his family's living standards.  

He aspires to open a boutique and a cosmetic business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for his business.

loans.name: Rasmita

texts.en:
Muniguda is a small town in the Rayagada District of Odisha in India. It has five slum areas where families from a poor background, in the "Below Poverty Line (BPL)" category, reside. Rasmita’s family is one of them. Rasmita, a 24-year-old lady, lives with her husband, a daughter (age 3), father-in-law and mother-in-law. Rasmita makes and sells leaf plates to add some income to her family with the financial support of Mahashakti. She purchases sal leaves (one type of forest leaves) from the tribal peoples, then stitches leaf plates and sells to the wholesaler in the same village. Her husband sells silver utensils moving from village to village. He does this business from 6 a.m. to 3 p.m. Although Rasmita is managing her family with the limited income from these two businesses, her family is facing lots of problems due to the lack of essential facilities like a toilet. 

In rural India, including rural Odisha, 80% of diseases happen due to the use of polluted water. The data say only 7% of rural areas are covered by toilet facilities in Odisha and the national figure is only 22%. Rasmita says, after her marriage when she came to her husband’s house, there was no toilet in their house. She faced many complicated and embarrassing situations due to outside defecation. In the rainy season, the situation is most horrible. So she is determined to provide a toilet facility for her family members and wants to construct a toilet by taking out a loan of 20,000 Indian rupees in two phases. By doing this, she feels that it will be a solace to her father-in-law and mother-in-law who are very old.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a toilet

loans.name: Luis Rigoberto

texts.es:
Luis es un joven soltero de 25 años vive en Chunchi un cantón ubicado en la Provincia de Chimborazo, de la República del Ecuador. Chunchi tiene clima frío que acompañado de lluvias frecuentes y un nutrido suelo, favorece la agricultura en este sector. Tiene varios lugares naturales como cascadas, lagos, páramos que son considerados lugares turísticos que son visitados con cierta frecuencia y aportan al desarrollo de esta ciudad. Se presentan porcentajes de analfabetismo que superan el 20% y el 78% de pobreza por lo que a muchos en la población se les dificulta acceder a algunos servicios básicos. 
A pesar de estos antecedentes, hay personas que no se han dado por vencidas frente a los obstáculos de la falta de educación, como es el caso de Luis quien alcanzó apenas a terminar la primaria, pero a sus quince años ya aprendió de sus padres el oficio de criar cerdos para luego comercializarlos. Con ocho horas diarias combinadas también con actividades de agricultura, Luis espera mejorar su estilo de vida, para lo cual necesita obtener un préstamo para comprar cerdos, arreglar los criaderos y posteriormente comercializarlos en un precio competitivo.
texts.en: Luis is a young single man of 25 who lives in Chunchi, a village located in the province of Chimborazo, Ecuador. Chunchi has a cool climate with frequent rains and a fertile soil, encouraging agriculture in the area. It has a number of natural wonders like waterfalls and lakes, which are considered tourist attractions that are visited with a certain frequency and support the area's development. More than 20 percent of the population is illiterate and 78 percent is in poverty, so much of the population has difficulty accessing basic services. Despite these setbacks, there are people who don't back down in the face of the obstacles presented by a lack of education. Such is the case with Luis, who barely finished primary school but at age 15 learned the trade of raising pigs to sell from his parents. With eight hours a day combined with agricultural activities, Luis hopes to improve his quality of life. He is requesting the loan to purchase pigs and fix his pens, so he can later sell the pigs at a competitive price.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and improve his pens.

loans.name: Vilma Isabel

texts.es: Vilma Isabel de 20 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo, dos hijos y su padre de avanzada edad.  Vilma como toda madre de familia responsable y trabajadora se esfuerza día con día para salir adelante, ella se dedica a la venta de de maíz y frijoles los cuales también siembra y cosecha en su propia parcela. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz y frijoles para sembrar, con lo que se asegurará aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la economía de su familia lo cual es lo principal para Vilma.
texts.en: Vilma Isabel is 20 years old and lives with her husband and their two children, as well as her elderly father. Vilma, like all responsible and hardworking mothers, works arduously every day to make headway. She makes a living selling corn and beans, which she also plants and harvests on her own plot of land. She is requesting the loan to purchase larger quantities of corn and bean seeds to plant, which will ensure increased revenue and improve the family finances, which is her main goal.

loans.use: to purchase corn and bean seeds.

loans.name: Djro Oklounonton Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJRO OKLOUNONTON est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même localité au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Yvette, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Yvette est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Séïdou. Le couple a huit enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Yvette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près d’une quinzaine d’année que Yvette exerce comme activité, la vente des cartes de recharges et divers produits dans son  quartier; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Yvette s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Yvette désire renforcer et diversifier son activité. Pour ce faire, Yvette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJRO OKLOUNONTON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The DJRO OKLOUNONTON group consists of three members who live in the same locality in Benin.

Yvette, the group's representative, is the one raising her hand in the photo. It is the fourth time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé, in order to raise the level of its activity.  

Yvette is 42 years old and married to a retailer named Séïdou.  Yvette and Séïdou have eight children who are all in their care.  Some of their children attend school.  Parents and children live together, and the couple jointly takes care of the various expenses of the household.  Yvette never attended school. 

Yvette has been selling telephone recharge cards and various products, in her neighborhood, for almost fifteen years.   Thanks to this activity, she is able to meet her needs without much difficulty.  She buys her goods locally, in her region.

In order to better meet the needs of her customers, Yvette would like to boost and diversify her activity.  This is why she is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the DJRO OKLOUNONTON  group. 

Previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy telephone recharge cards and various products.

loans.name: Leisy Marilif

texts.es:
Leisy, está decidida a seguir trabajando en su negocio, que es una  tienda de  víveres y de cereales, nos ha solicitado otro préstamo para la compra de maíz en quintal, concentrados, gas, carnes, embutidos, boquitas entre otros.
El crédito anterior tuvo mucho beneficio ya que le ayudo a aumentar el inventario y a diversificar los productos, para darle una mejor atención al cliente. Su hogar ha mejorado y su propósito es poner ladrillo al piso de la vivienda.
texts.en: Leisy is dedicated to continue with her business, a store selling groceries and grains. She is requesting another loan to purchase corn, concentrates, propane, meats, sausages, snacks and other items. The previously loan was very beneficial since it helped her increase her inventory and diversify her products, giving her better customer service. Her household has improved and her goal is to pave her home's floor.

loans.use: to purchase corn, concentrates, propane, meats and sausages.

loans.name: Prafulla

texts.en: Prafulla is a married woman, age 41, from the village of Hata Muniguda in the Rayagada District of Odisha, India. She has a small family comprised of her husband and two daughters. Her husband is a daily wage earner working in a rice mill and earning a monthly wage of 6,000 Indian rupees (INR) with which it is very hard to maintain the family. In spite of her awareness, with this small income source, she was not capable of building a toilet for the family. So they are bound to go outside for defecation and suffer from many health hazards which results in financial burden. Prafulla says, "It is really very painful for us to go outside for defecation because it relates to social prestige." So Prafulla wants to invest this 20,000 INR loan in the construction of a toilet to save her family from the social embarrassment as well as the many health problems. In her sentiments she also says that she will be very happy to have a toilet in her house because of her two grown-up girls.

loans.use: to pay for construction of a toilet

loans.name: Morena

texts.es: Morena de 24 años de edad, es una joven madre de familia quien vive junto a su madre y sus dos hijos de 1 y 4 años de edad quienes dependen por completo de ella. Morena posee una pequeña parcela en la cual se encarga de sembrar maíz y frijoles, los cuales posteriormente comercializa por mayor a diferentes clientes, su negocio es bastante estable, en el cual desea invertir en lo más posible, ya que es gracias a este como ella logra sostener a su familia. Morena solicita un préstamo con el deseo de comprar todos los productos necesario para el cuidado de sus plantaciones, tales como abono, pesticidas, maíz, así de esta forma ella espera poder mejorar su trabajo y poder brindar un mejor servicio sus clientes.
texts.en: Morena is 24 years old and is a young mother.  She lives with her mother and her two children, ages 1 and 4, who are completely dependent on her.  Morena has a small parcel of land on which she grows corn and beans, which she then sells wholesale to different customers.  Her business is quite stable, and she wants to invest in it as much as possible, since her business allows her to support her family.  Morena is asking for a loan so she can purchase all of the products she needs to care for her plants, such as fertilizer, pesticides, and corn seed.  She hopes that these inputs will improve her crops so she can provide a better service to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to care for her plants.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She owns a clothing business, which she has been operating for 3 years. Sarah started the business from a ‘merry go round’: a self-help scheme where members contribute equal amounts and lend the money to one person at a time.

Sarah learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are high fuel and transport costs, price fluctuation and inflation, and taxes. 

Sarah is applying for a loan of 10,250 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of second hand clothes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings. Her dream is to open other clothing businesses in other areas.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a resident of Malindi of Coast Province, Kenya. She has three children who all attend school. She owns a food cafe - a business that she has been operating for 2 years. She sells rice, beans, potatoes, etc.

Eunice learned about Milango through an employee with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenge is low income during the low season.

Eunice is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to purchase some flour, sugar, cereal, cooking oil, and potatoes for the cafe. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to improve her family's standard of living. She aspires to open a big restaurant in future.

loans.use: to buy some flour, sugar, cereal, cooking oil, and potatoes for the cafe.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha lives in the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four children. 

She owns a clothes business that she has operated for three years. Sarah started the business from a "merry go round": a self-help scheme where members contribute equal amounts and lend the money to one person at a time.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group.  She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are high fuel and transport costs, price fluctuations and inflation, and taxes. 

Furaha is applying for a loan of KES 10,250 to purchase additional stocks of second-hand clothes. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to increase her savings. 

Her dream is to open other clothes businesses in other areas.

loans.use: To purchase an additional stock of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has five children. 

Christine owns a retail shop that sells juice, bottled water, sweets, etc. and the business has been operating for 5 years. She started the business through her personal savings. Apart from this, she is also employed.

She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenges are price fluctuations and inflation.

Christine is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to renovate the shop and purchase fat, sugar, water, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her repay the loan. Her future plan is to expand to a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to renovate the shop and purchase fat, sugar, water, etc.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is grateful for the support given her through her last loan. She says that she was able to increase her inventory in her vegetable stall. 

Since she has seen it become a profitable business, she is asking for a new loan so as to expand her business. With this loan, she will be able to buy fruits and vegetables. 

Her goal is open a cereal shop in future. She promises to make her payments on time so as to ask for more loans.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is requesting a new loan because she considers it necessary to purchase more merchandise for her shoes and accessory business. 

Dorcas is motivated with her work on the stall, since it will allow her to support the needs of her household. With the help she's being given, she has more security. She has kept a good number of customers thus far.

With this new loan, she will buy more stock of shoes and accessories for resale.  Her aspirations are to own a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of shoes and accessories for sale.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a devoted mother who always tries to use every opportunity that comes across. She still operates her spare parts selling business, which has enabled her to cater for her household expenses without great burden. 

Anna has returned to Yehu and Kiva to request her third loan to invest in her business. She has a good credit reference, since she has successfully repaid her previous loans. 

With this loan, she will increase her stock of spare parts and be able to offer a variety to her customers.

loans.use: To increase her stock of spare parts.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu lives with her four children.  She is dedicated to selling spare parts, a business she loves because it gives what she requires. She depends on this business to earn a living and provide for the needs of her home. 

She requests a new loan to invest in the purchase of more spare parts. This loan will allow her business to increase sales and improve her daily life.

Her goal is to improve her customer service, so her economic situation is not affected, and she can give a better economic stability to her children.

loans.use: To purchase of more spare parts.

loans.name: Ephata Group

texts.fr: La cliente Ushindi est un membre du groupe de crédit Ephata, jeune femme dynamique, entrepreneur, âgée de 22 ans, sans enfant, nouvellement mariée. Elle est vendeuse dans sa propre quincaillerie. Elle s’entraide avec son mari qui est quincailleur. Avant de se marier, elle fut initiée par son père qui est aussi quincailleur. Ainsi, donc, cette cliente maîtrise parfaitement ce secteur de matériaux de construction. Les bénéfices de son activité servent d’épargne, d’alimentation. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir son 5eme crédit. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec un lot de matériels électriques. En plus, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle dans le futur entant donné qu’ils sont encore de nouveaux mariés. La cliente remercie Hekima pour les actions d’autonomisation de pauvres femmes à faible revenu. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
The borrower,  Ushindi, is a member of the Ephata credit group.  She is a dynamic young entrepreneur, age 22, who recently got married and doesn't have any children yet.  

She is a salesperson in her own hardware store and she works with her husband who is also a hardware seller.  Ushindi learned her trade from her father before getting married, and she is now quite an expert in the field of construction supplies.  Her father also worked in hardware.

Ushindi uses the profits from her business to put some money into savings and to buy food.  

She has now just received her fifth loan and plans to use it to buy some electric supplies.

In the future, she and her husband would like to buy a plot of land as they are still newlyweds.

Ushindi thanks Hekima for helping low-income women become independent.  

It should be noted that, [in the photo], some of the borrowers are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy electric supplies.

loans.name: Genaro

texts.es:
Genaro, es casado y tiene tres hijos dos de los cuales ya son independientes y el ultimo esta en etapa escolar, viven en una casa alquilada ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de ocho horas al día  en una empresa confeccionando buzos deportivos y también cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes que es  administrada por  su esposa ( que aparece en la foto adjunta) ya que ambos solventan los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de una maquina recta para la confección de los buzos deportivos ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos de forma independiente.
El sueño de Genaro, es conseguir  una casa en anticrético para dar más comodidad a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida, y lo más importante, ahorrar los alquileres que actualmente paga.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Genaro is married and has three children, two of whom are already independent; the youngest is school-aged. They live in a rented house, occupying three rooms. The house is located in the Pampahasi area of the city of La Paz.

Currently, he works more than eight hours a day in a company making tracksuits, and also has a grocery store run by his wife, who appears in the above photo. Both of them contribute to their family's expenses for food, education and payment of basic services. 

He needs the loan for the purchase of a single-needle sewing machine for making tracksuits, as he wishes to improve his income by working independently.

Genaro's dream is to obtain a house through "anticrético" (lump-sum loan in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to the occupant at the end of the contract). This is in order to give his family more comfort, improve their quality of life, and most important, to not have to pay the rent that he currently pays.

It is the first time he has applied for a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a single needle sewing machine for starting his own business making tracksuits.

loans.name: Tereza Elena

texts.es:
Tereza de 36 años, una mujer soltera sus estudios llegaron hasta nivel primario,  trabaja para mantener a sus 3 hijos de doce, diez y seis años quienes apoyan a Tereza en su trabajo. Viven en el Barrio de la Cooperativa 20 de Octubre en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, una ciudad de Ecuador muy importante que está entre las 4 más pobladas y su economía se mueve gracias a las actividades agrícolas, ganaderas, y el turismo ya que existen varios lugares que son atractivos para turistas nacionales e internacionales, por lo que la comercialización de artesanías, hoteles, transporte y comida es muy común en el centro de esta ciudad.
Tereza usa  el arte culinario para subsistir, ella cocina y vende “encebollados” comida típica del lugar, elaborado a base de pescado y vegetales, inició su negocio hace un año con una pequeña cocina  y por el rico sabor de su comida ha conseguido que varios clientes la prefieran por lo que Tereza quiere invertir y abrir otro lugar para poder vender más encebollados y de esta manera poder hacer que todos sus hijos puedan estudiar. El sueño de esta mujer trabajadora es  llegar a tener un gran restaurante donde venda una gran variedad de comidas por esto ella está en busca de su primer crédito y sabe que con trabajo y el sabor de sus comidas le irá muy bien.
texts.en: Tereza is 36 years old, single and has a primary-school education. She works to provide for her three children, ages 12, 10 and 6, who help her with her business. They live in the Cooperativa 20 de Octubre neighborhood in the city of Santo Domingo, one of Ecuador's most important cities. It is among the four most populated and has a bustling economy thanks to the agriculture, livestock and tourism industries. There are a number of attractive sights nearby for domestic and international tourists, so artwork, hotels, transportation and food services are very common in the city center. Tereza uses culinary art to make a living. She cooks and sells "encebollados", a traditional local dish made with fish and vegetables. She started her business a year ago in a small kitchen, and thanks to the rich flavor of her food she has acquired numerous customers, so Tereza wants to invest and open another location so she can sell more encebollados and in this way she can afford for all of her kids to go to school. The dream of this hardworking woman is to come to have a great restaurant selling a wide variety of foods, which is why she is requesting her first loan. She knows with work and the flavor of her food that things will go very well.

loans.use: to open a new location.

loans.name: Egga

texts.en:
Egga is 46 years old and is married to Joto, who is a farmer. Together they have two grown children. She has been a housewife for long until she was able to start a business out of her home. She started her own business in 2004, and she already has a large base of customers.

She presently buys and sells goats at the market. However, she does not go to the market herself; instead, her older son operates it for her. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín, es soltero y tiene un hijo que esta en etapa escolar, vive en la casa de sus padres ocupando solo una habitación pequeña con paredes de ladrillo y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas al día y hasta altas horas de la noche como chofer propietario de un taxi, ya que debe cubrir los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehículo ya que desea cambiar algunos repuestos (filtro de aire, liquidos para frenos, pastillas para frenos y mantenimiento en general) ya que es la única fuente de trabajo que tiene para mantener a su familia.
El sueño de Efraín, es mejorar sus ingresos para conseguir una casa en anticrético para dar más comodidad a su familia ya que desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la tercera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Efraín is single, and has a school-aged son. He lives in his parents' home, occupying a single, small room with brick walls and earth floor. The house is located in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.

Currently, he works more than 10 hours a day and until late at night driving the the taxi that he owns. His must cover his family's expenses for education, food and payment of basic services.

He needs the loan for maintaining his vehicle. He wishes to replace some parts (air filter, brake pads), replace the brake fluid and do general maintenance, as this is the only source of work he has for supporting his family.

Efraín's dream is to improve his income in order to obtain a house through "anticrético" (lump-sum loan provided in exchange for housing tenure, where the loan must be paid back to the lender/occupant at the end of a specified period). This is in order to provide more comfort to his family, as he wishes to improve their quality of life.

This is the third time he has applied for a loan with IMPRO, and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: To pay expenses for maintaining his taxi.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is 41 years old. She has a small retail shop which she has run since 2003. She is a very enterprising and hardworking person. She notes that she began with a small business and that later, thanks to hard work and sacrifice, began adding more products. Her goal is to continue growing so that she will have better earnings for the day to day needs. Nyamvula is married and has seven children.

She is applying for a loan to purchase sugar, rice, beans, cooking fat and other supplies to stock her shop. She describes price fluctuations to be her major challenge.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, beans, cooking fat and other supplies

loans.name: Ega

texts.en: Ega comes from the town of Samburu. She is very hardworking, as evinced day after day by all her efforts. She is a shopkeeper. She has a locale she uses as a general store, which she opens for business very early in the morning. Ega is a married mother who has 8 children. Thanks to all her efforts; she has been able to educate her children despite her advanced age. Ega was one of the first in her neighborhood to have a general store, and thus has a very strong customer base. In spite of her age, her goal is to make her business keep growing, and this is why she asks for this loan. She wishes to invest the funds in her shop and supply it with sugar, flour, rice, detergents, and other supplies. She is thankful for the opportunity granted by the field partner and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, flour, rice, detergents, and other supplies

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama, 40, is married and has seven children. She tells us that she has a well-stocked store that supplies her neighborhood. She says that she started with a small vegetable stall, and then she decided to change her business and make a living through the store, which is going very well for her. She has good customers since she is friendly with them and all of her business's products are priced well.

Salama is requesting this loan to buy sugar, tea leaves, beans, rice, and drinks. This will help her business to have a good stock and give her family what it needs. She describes herself as a hard-working person with a great enterprising spirit.

loans.use: to buy sugar, tea leaves, beans, rice, and drinks.

loans.name: Juhaje

texts.en:
Juhaje is 50 years old. She is a widow and all her children are adults and independent. She lives in her modest home in the town of Samburu.
She has been a merchant for over 5 years. She began selling livestock,with her husband. Her son is in charge of it now. Juhaje requests the loan to purchase more goats for sale. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the support and the confidence that they have shown her.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for sale.

loans.name: Abunzubumwe/ Kzh Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Torojani est le membre et le président du groupe Abunzubumwe / Kzh. Le nom du groupe signifie «Les membres unis».Il a 40 ans et il est marié avec 7 enfants de 2 ans  à 16 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de secondaire.

Torojani est cultivateur de riz. C’est son quatrième cycle de prêt avec ACB et il dit que le crédit antérieur a aidé ses activités de l’agriculture de riz beaucoup et il n’a pas attendue aucunes difficultés de non remboursement du crédit. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, il planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait être le meilleur producteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Torojani is a member and the president of the Abunzubumwe / Kzh group.  The name of the group means "United members".  He is 40 years old, married, and has seven children whose ages range between 2 and 16 years.  Four of his children are in school.  Torojani's own level of education is six years of secondary school.

Torojani is a rice farmer.  This is his fourth loan cycle with ACB.  According to him, his previous loan really helped his rice farming business, and he is not expecting any repayment difficulty for this current loan.  He will use this loan to buy some fertilizers and to pay for the cost of labor for his rice-growing business.

In order to boost his rice farming business, Trojan is planning to request additional loans, which will help him to increase his rice-growing capacities.  In the coming years, he would like to be the best rice producer in his region.  He is planning to use his profits to pay for his children's school fees and healthcare costs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to cover the cost of labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay labour costs.

loans.name: Twitezimbere/ Shr Group

texts.fr:
Antoinette est le membre et la présidente du groupe Twitezimbere /Shr . Le nom du groupe signifie «se développer».Elle a 33 ans et elle est mariée avec 2 enfants de 6 ans à 11 ans, dont 2 scolarisés. Elle a 1 personne  en charge autres que ses enfants.  Son niveau d’éducation est de 6 ans de primaire.

Antoinette est cultivatrice de riz. C’est son deuxième  cycle de prêt avec ACB et elle dit que le crédit antérieur a aidé ses activités de l’agriculture de riz beaucoup et elle n’a pas attendue aucunes difficultés de non remboursement du crédit. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre pour son activité d’agriculture de riz. 

Pour accroitre son agriculture du riz, elle planifie de demander d’autres prêt pour augmenter la capacité de ses activités de la culture de riz. Dans les prochaines années, elle voudrait être le meilleur producteur de riz dans la région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et médicaux de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Antoinette is a member and the president of the Twitezimbere /Shr group.  The name of the group means "developing our activities".  She is 33 years old, married, and has two children, ages  6 and 11, who both attend school. In addition to her children, she has another person in her care.  Antoinette's level of education is six years of primary school.

Antoinette is a rice farmer. This is her second loan cycle with ACB. According to her, her previous loan really helped her rice farming business, and she is not expecting any repayment difficulty for this current loan. She will use her loan to buy some fertilizers and to pay for the cost of labor for her rice growing business.

In order to boost her farming business, Antoinette is planning to request additional loans, which will help her to increase her rice growing capacities. In the coming years, she would like to be the best rice producer in her region. She is planning to use her profits to pay for her children's school fees and healthcare costs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for the cost of labor.

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.fr: PELAGIE est une femme mariée, agée de 32ans  mère de 02 enfants. Elle est couturière dans un quartier de la capital où elle fait dans la couture mixte, elle a 06 apprentis et  un permanant. PELAGIE coud sur commande et fait également l'exposition. Grace à son savoir faire et à son expérience dans ce domaine, elle a conquis et fidelisée une clientèle au fil de temps. La croissance continuelle de cette clientèle rend son offre inférieur à la demande. Face à cette situation, elle aimerait prendre un crédit qui lui permettra d'acheter des tissus pour augmenter le stock pour la confection des habits, un mannequin pour l'exposition et une machine à coudre. Ceci augmentera son chiffre d'affaires et donc sa marge bénéficiaire. Elle économisera une partie de ce bénéfice pour la scolarisation de ses enfants à l'école et le reste sera réinvesti dans son activité pour l'agrandir.
texts.en:
Pelagie is a married woman, who is 32 years of age and mother to two children. She works as a seamstress in a neighborhood in the capital, where she carries out a wide variety of sewing. She has six apprentices, as well as one permanent member of staff.

Pelagie works to order, and also makes display items. Thanks to her know-how and experience in this field, she has built up a loyal customer base over time. The constant growth in customer numbers means that supply is lower than demand. Faced with this situation, Pelagie would like to take out a loan so that she can buy fabrics to increase her stock for dressmaking, a mannequin for display purposes, and a sewing machine. This will increase her sales and, consequently, her profit margin. Pelagie plans to save part of these profits for her children’s education, and will reinvest the rest in expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, a mannequin, and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Leonor De Jesus

texts.es:
Leonor, está solicitando otro crédito, por la buena atención que Padecomsm crédito le brinda y  porque  necesita  comprar insumos para surtir la tienda por ejemplo: comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, y otros productos para la tienda.
Expresa que el crédito anterior tuvo un gran efecto, ya que le ayudo a fortalecer su vivienda con la compra de puertas y ventanas de balcon, con su negocio y con las ganancias a logrado sacar adelante a su familia, se ha mantenido en el mercado y ha crecido en términos de ingresos y clientes.
texts.en:
Leonor is requesting another loan as a result of the good management of the credit that PADECOMSM has given her. She needs to buy merchandise to restock her store such as rice, beans, oil, and other products.

Leonor says that her previous loan had a great effect. It helped to secure her home since she was able to buy doors and balcony windows. In her business, the earnings she generated helped her family to move forward. She has maintained her standing in the marketplace and has grown in terms of her income and the number of customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Justo, es casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en la casa de sus suegros ocupando solo una habitación pequeña con paredes de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja por más de diez horas realizando todo trabajo de chaperia y pintura de vehículos ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de educación, alimentación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de pintura y material para realizar sus trabajos en su taller de chaperia ya que desea mejorar sus ingresos.
El sueño de Justo, es conseguir un anticrético para dar más comodidad a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y KIVA.
Para una mayor información, un Anticrético es un acuerdo legal entre el dueño de casa o de departamento y un potencial inquilino para que este último pueda  vivir por un tiempo no mayor a dos años, por una suma de dinero entregada a la firma del acuerdo y que será devuelta a la finalización del acuerdo. De esta manera, el inquilino logra ahorrar un dinero que de otra manera lo hubiera gastado si viviese en alquiler.
texts.en:
Justo is married, and has two school-aged children. They live in their in-laws' house, occupying a single small room with adobe walls and earth floor. The house is located in the Tembladerani area of the city of La Paz.

Currently, he works more than ten hours a day, doing all kinds of bodywork, and vehicle painting. He is the only one covering his family's expenses for education, food, and payment of basic services.

He needs the loan to buy paint and materials for carrying out his work in his auto body shop, as he wishes to improve his income.
